cards.title: "Armadillo" Armored Road Home
cards.text:
Put 2[bit] from the bank on Armored Road Home when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. 
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits from the bank on Armored Road Home when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.  trash: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

cards.title: "Drifter" Mobile Environment
cards.text: Put 2[bit] from the bank on Mobile Environment when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits from the bank on Mobile Environment when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: "Green Knight" Surge Buffers
cards.text: Prevents 1 Net damage each turn.
cards.stripped_text: Prevents 1 Net damage each turn.

cards.title: Aardvark
cards.text: Runner cannot use worms during runs on this fort. If Runner uses a worm during a run on this fort before Aardvark is rezzed, you may rez Aardvark to trash that worm, and any bits spent using that worm on the current piece of ice are lost to no effect. Runner may then use further icebreakers to break the ice.
cards.stripped_text: Runner cannot use worms during runs on this fort. If Runner uses a worm during a run on this fort before Aardvark is rezzed, you may rez Aardvark to trash that worm, and any bits spent using that worm on the current piece of ice are lost to no effect. Runner may then use further icebreakers to break the ice.

cards.title: Access through Alpha
cards.text: 1[bit]: Base link 9. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Base link 9. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.flavor: "Wilderspace is made up of those areas of the Net that have not already been catalogued into one region or another" —Spider Murphy

cards.title: Access to Arasaka
cards.text:
2[bit]: Base link 4.
2[bit]: +1 link.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Base link 4. 2 bits: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

cards.title: Access to Kiribati
cards.text:
1[bit]: Base link 1.
1[bit]: +1 link.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Base link 1. 1 bit: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.flavor: Third-World security and First-World bureaucracy—together at last.

cards.title: Accounts Receivable
cards.text: Gain 9[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Gain 9 bits.
cards.flavor:
"If we don't receive payment in full by tomorrow, we'll be obliged to repossess."
"But... but the equipment's already been installed in our employees."

cards.title: ACME Savings and Loan
cards.text: Rezzing ACME S&L costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. When you rez ACME S&L, gain 12[bit] and trash ACME S&L. For the remainder of the game, pay 1[bit] at the end of each of your turns, or lose the game. You can remove this effect, and score 1 agenda point, by taking an action to pay 12[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Rezzing ACME S&L costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. When you rez ACME S&L, gain 12 bits and trash ACME S&L. For the remainder of the game, pay 1 bit at the end of each of your turns, or lose the game. You can remove this effect, and score 1 agenda point, by taking an action to pay 12 bits.

cards.title: Afreet
cards.text:
Afreet can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it.
All icebreakers installed in Afreet have their strength reduced by 1.
If Afreet leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.
cards.stripped_text: Afreet can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in Afreet have their strength reduced by 1. If Afreet leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.

cards.title: AI Boon
cards.text: 1[bit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[bit]: +1 strength. At the start of each run, roll a die to determine AI Boon's strength * for that run.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break sentry subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength. At the start of each run, roll a die to determine AI Boon's strength * for that run.
cards.flavor: "Everything was going great until a Viral 18 wiped the instruction manual."

cards.title: AI Chief Financial Officer
cards.text: [action]: Shuffle cards stored in HQ and the Archives into R&D; then draw five cards.
cards.stripped_text: action: Shuffle cards stored in HQ and the Archives into R&D; then draw five cards.
cards.flavor: "I think it's 'preferred' stock because their AI financial adviser prefers not to risk changing the board of directors!"

cards.title: All-Nighter
cards.text: Make a run; whether or not that run is successful, you may then make another run.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run; whether or not that run is successful, you may then make another run.
cards.flavor: "Of course, you start to hallucinate if you string too many of these together."

cards.title: Annual Reviews
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.stripped_text: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: "Just between you and me, this wouldn't be a bad time to impress the boss with your initiative."

cards.title: Anonymous Tip
cards.text: Derez a piece of black ice of your choice.
cards.stripped_text: Derez a piece of black ice of your choice.
cards.flavor: "Netwatch doesn't take hints about corporate infractions. If you really want them to apply some heat to a patch of black ice, get a Hellhound to follow your link back to their offices."

cards.title: Antiquated Interface Routines
cards.text: All ice on this fort has +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: All ice on this fort has +1 strength.

cards.title: Arasaka Owns You
cards.text: Do not play Arasaka Owns You as a normal action; instead, play it when you would suffer enough damage to flatline you. Prevent all of that damage, trash Arasaka Owns You, remove any brain damage you have suffered, and then refresh your hand to its maximum size. Gain 10[bit] and remove all tags, at no cost. You forgo your next four actions, and you forfeit the next 3 agenda points you score.
cards.stripped_text: Do not play Arasaka Owns You as a normal action; instead, play it when you would suffer enough damage to flatline you. Prevent all of that damage, trash Arasaka Owns You, remove any brain damage you have suffered, and then refresh your hand to its maximum size. Gain 10 bits and remove all tags, at no cost. You forgo your next four actions, and you forfeit the next 3 agenda points you score.

cards.title: Arasaka Portable Prototype
cards.text:
Provides +3 MU.
Installing Arasaka Portable Prototype costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost.
Put 3[bit] from the bank on Arasaka Portable Prototype when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Armored Fridge
cards.text: Put seven Ablative counters on Armored Fridge when it is installed. When the last Ablative counter has been removed, trash Armored Fridge. Ablative counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Put seven Ablative counters on Armored Fridge when it is installed. When the last Ablative counter has been removed, trash Armored Fridge. Ablative counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
cards.flavor: "I also once shut off the hot water line to my dishwasher and hid in there while it was running, but I'll never do that again." —Rache Bartmoss

cards.title: Artemis 2020
cards.text:
Provides +2 MU.
Put 2[bit] from the bank on Artemis 2020 when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +2 MU. Put 2 bits from the bank on Artemis 2020 when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. cards.title: Artificial Security Directors
cards.text: Difficulty of Black Ops agendas is reduced by 1.
cards.stripped_text: Difficulty of Black Ops agendas is reduced by 1.
cards.flavor: "We noticed a while ago that security directors developing cyberpsychosis—becoming less and less human—increased the effectiveness of our Black Ops dramatically. Unfortunately, they quickly became too unstable to be useful. This new program should solve all these problems, and more." —Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

cards.title: Asp
cards.text: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay 1 bit.
cards.flavor: Oh how sharper than a serpent's tooth is one of these suckers clamped onto the boot sector of a drive!

cards.title: Audit of Call Records
cards.text: Play only if Runner attempted two or more runs during his or her last turn.  Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner attempted two or more runs during his or her last turn. Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

cards.title: Aujourd'Oui
cards.text: [action]: Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any program cards among them into your hand. Pay 1[bit] for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle your stack.
cards.stripped_text: action: Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any program cards among them into your hand. Pay 1 bit for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle your stack.

cards.title: Back Door to Hilliard
cards.text:
0[bit]: Base link 2.
3[bit]: +1 link.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Base link 2. 3 bits: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.flavor: Hilliard Registrar query confirmed for ICE UNIT CERBERUS BD62663-R. "Sorry, Mr. Cerberus, that class is full, though if you obtain authorization from your proctor, you may petition for entrance."

cards.title: Back Door to Orbital Air
cards.text:
1[bit]: Base link 2.
2[bit]: +1 link.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Base link 2. 2 bits: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.flavor: If you think the airlines are good at losing luggage, you should see what they can do with a trace attempt.

cards.title: Baedeker's Net Map
cards.text: 0[bit]: Base link 1. 1[bit]: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Base link 1. 1 bit: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.flavor: "I knew I should have taken the left region from Albuquerque!"

cards.text: 0[bit]: Base link 3. 2[bit]: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Base link 3. 2 bits: +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

cards.text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay 2[bit] when encountering a piece of ice, in addition to any other costs, or end the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay 2 bits when encountering a piece of ice, in addition to any other costs, or end the run.

[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: The survival of Bushido into cyberspace has spiritual significance to many execs.

cards.title: Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker
cards.text: 1[bit]: Break ice subroutine. 1[bit]: +1 strength. After passing each piece of ice, roll a die if you used Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker to break any subroutines of that ice. On a 1, trash Memorial Icebreaker.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break ice subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength. After passing each piece of ice, roll a die if you used Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker to break any subroutines of that ice. On a 1, trash Memorial Icebreaker.

[action]: Take 2[bit] from BBS Whispering Campaign.

cards.title: Bioweapons Engineering
cards.text: Each source of meat damage inflicts +1 meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Each source of meat damage inflicts +1 meat damage.

cards.title: Bizarre Encryption Scheme
cards.text: Runner does not score any agenda (or agendas) during a run in which Bizarre Encryption Scheme is accessed; return that agenda to the fort instead. Runner scores the agenda at the start of his or her next turn if neither you nor Runner has scored it by then. This does not affect any further runs.

cards.title: Black Dahlia
cards.text: 2[bit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break sentry subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "She broke my heart—but at least she showed it to me first."

cards.title: Black Ice Quality Assurance
cards.text: All black ice has +2 strength.
cards.stripped_text: All black ice has +2 strength.

cards.title: Blink
cards.text: 0[bit]: Roll a die. On a 4, 5, or 6, break ice subroutine; otherwise, suffer that much Net damage. Use this ability only once on each subroutine during each encounter with a piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Roll a die. On a 4, 5, or 6, break ice subroutine; otherwise, suffer that much Net damage. Use this ability only once on each subroutine during each encounter with a piece of ice.

cards.text: [action]:Trace 5 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: action:Trace 5 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.flavor: "These break-ins are unacceptable. Put the Cat on him. I want this character tagged so tight we know when he sheds a hair!"

cards.title: Boardwalk
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Boardwalk counter. At the start of each
of your turns, every two Boardwalk counters require the Corp to show you, at random, a card stored in HQ. If the Corp does not have enough cards stored in HQ, the Corp shows you as many cards as it has. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Boardwalk counter. At the start of each of your turns, every two Boardwalk counters require the Corp to show you, at random, a card stored in HQ. If the Corp does not have enough cards stored in HQ, the Corp shows you as many cards as it has. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.title: Bodyweight™️ Data Crèche
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU.
Once per turn, right after making a successful run, you can choose to make another run without taking an action to do so.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU. Once per turn, right after making a successful run, you can choose to make another run without taking an action to do so. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.flavor: "I better hijack another order for a five-gallon saline feed.... I might be in here a while."

cards.title: Bodyweight™️ Synthetic Blood
cards.text: Draw five cards.
cards.stripped_text: Draw five cards.

[subroutine] Do 4 Net damage.
[subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 4 Net damage. [subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.

Take 2[bit] from Braindance Campaign at the start of each of your turns. When all the bits have been removed, trash Braindance Campaign.

cards.flavor: "So it's a subliminal. What they don't know won't hurt them."

cards.title: Broker

Each of your turns, you may take only one action to use Broker.
[action]: Put 3[bit] from the bank on Broker.
[action]: Take all the bits from Broker.
cards.stripped_text: Each of your turns, you may take only one action to use Broker. action: Put 3 bits from the bank on Broker. action: Take all the bits from Broker.

cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Butcher Boy counter. Every two Butcher Boy counters gain you 1 bit at the start of each of your turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all further ice is encountered at +2 strength.

Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Cascade counter. Every two Cascade
counters require the Corp to trash faceup one card stored in R&D, at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Cascade counter. Every two Cascade counters require the Corp to trash faceup one card stored in R&D, at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.title: Cerberus

[subroutine] Do 3 Net damage.
[subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a Cerberus counter. Each Cerberus counter does 2 Net damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Cerberus counter by taking an action to spend 4[bit].

cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 3 Net damage. [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a Cerberus counter. Each Cerberus counter does 2 Net damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Cerberus counter by taking an action to spend 4 bits. [subroutine] End the run.

Play only if Runner attempted a run during his or her last turn.
Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

cards.stripped_text: Cost to install ice on this fort is reduced by 2 bits.

cards.title: Chicago Branch
cards.text: [action], 3[bit]: Add two advancement counters to an installed card that can be advanced.
cards.stripped_text: action, 3 bits: Add two advancement counters to an installed card that can be advanced.

cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Chimera, trash a daemon.

cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 6-If trace is successful, end the run, trash a piece of hardware, and do 2 meat damage. This damage cannot be prevented.

For each card Runner draws, give Runner a tag unless Runner pays 1[bit], in addition to any other costs, to avoid receiving that tag.

cards.title: Closed Accounts
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Runner loses all bits.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Runner loses all bits.
cards.flavor: "Watch out for the blast shelters First Eurobank builds around its As. They may be great for the rubes, but if some corp has marked your account as illegal, the shelter will seal you in until the cops come." —Kiyote

cards.title: Clown

cards.stripped_text: All ice is encountered with its strength reduced by 1.

cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Cockroach counter. Two or more Cockroach counters cause all discards from HQ to become random. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.text: 1[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break sentry subroutine.

cards.title: Corporate Retreat

[action]: Gain 2[bit].
cards.stripped_text: You lose the following ability as soon as you rez or install any card. action: Gain 2 bits.
cards.flavor: Hard work has a future payoff. Laziness pays off now.

cards.title: Corporate War
cards.text: If you have 12[bit] or more bits in your pool when you score Corporate War, gain 12[bit]; otherwise, lose all bits.
cards.stripped_text: If you have 12 bits or more bits in your pool when you score Corporate War, gain 12 bits; otherwise, lose all bits.
cards.flavor: The greatest casualty of the early corporate wars was the middle class.

cards.title: Corprunner's Shattered Remains
cards.text:
You may advance Shattered Remains before and after you rez it.
When Runner accesses Shattered Remains, it destroys one piece of hardware for each advancement counter on it.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Shattered Remains before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Shattered Remains, it destroys one piece of hardware for each advancement counter on it.
cards.flavor: "It's not that I like screwing you up. It's just that they got me wireed so I feel the routines like bugs on my neck, so believe it, brother—I'm gonna swat!"

cards.title: Cortical Scanner
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: Your brain's the key.

cards.title: Cortical Scrub
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Sounds nice and hygienic, eh?"

cards.title: Cowboy Sysop
cards.text: [action]: Choose one of your installed cards to be uninstalled. Store it in HQ.
cards.stripped_text: action: Choose one of your installed cards to be uninstalled. Store it in HQ.

cards.title: Crash Everett, Inventive Fixer
cards.text:
Whenever you draw one or more cards from your stack, draw an extra card; then choose one of the cards drawn and either trash it or return it to the top of your stack.
Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you draw one or more cards from your stack, draw an extra card; then choose one of the cards drawn and either trash it or return it to the top of your stack. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

cards.title: Crybaby
cards.text:
When Runner accesses Crybaby, give Runner a Crying counter.
Each Crying counter reduces Runner's link by 2 during each trace attempt.
Runner can remove a Crying counter by taking an action to pay 2[bit].
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Crybaby, give Runner a Crying counter. Each Crying counter reduces Runner's link by 2 during each trace attempt. Runner can remove a Crying counter by taking an action to pay 2 bits.

cards.title: Crystal Palace Station Grid
cards.text:
Runner must pay 1[bit], in addition to the normal cost, to break each subroutine of each piece of ice encountered during runs on this fort. Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Runner must pay 1 bit, in addition to the normal cost, to break each subroutine of each piece of ice encountered during runs on this fort. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Crystal Wall
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Yeah, the 'crystal' stuff is about as thick as walls get. But that just means the crunching noises are that much more gratifying when I hammer through it." —Kiyote

cards.title: Custodial Position
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access two additional cards from R&D.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access two additional cards from R&D.

cards.title: Cyfermaster
cards.text: 2[bit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break code gate subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: You can pick a lock; you can pick your friends. Now, thanks to Cyfermast...

cards.title: D'Arc Knight
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Do your worst, churl! I do not fear your best killers, your fastest evasion programs, your canniest AI routines. All of these I will face, and defeat."

cards.title: Danshi's Second ID
cards.text: [action], [trash]: Remove up to three tags, at no cost.
cards.stripped_text: action, trash: Remove up to three tags, at no cost.
cards.flavor: "I'll take the complete package: apartment, ID number, passports, credit account, fake diplomas, fingerprints, retinas..."

cards.title: Data Darts
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 3 Net damage.
[subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 3 Net damage. [subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.

cards.title: Data Fort Reclamation
cards.text: Gain 10[bit] and choose up to four cards stored in HQ when you score Data Fort Reclamation. Create a new data fort using the cards chosen. Install the cards one at a time; you may rez them when you install them. Then, return to the bank any of the 10[bit] not spent.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 10 bits and choose up to four cards stored in HQ when you score Data Fort Reclamation. Create a new data fort using the cards chosen. Install the cards one at a time; you may rez them when you install them. Then, return to the bank any of the 10 bits not spent.

cards.title: Data Masons
cards.text: Cost to rez walls is reduced by 2[bit]. All walls have +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: Cost to rez walls is reduced by 2 bits. All walls have +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "'An eye on top of a pyramid'? No, that's not our Net logo; you must have us confused with another outfit."

cards.title: Data Naga
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "As it says in the Upanishads, O thief: 'You have a right to your labor, but not to the fruits of your labor.'"

cards.title: Data Raven
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trace 5 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag and a Data Raven counter. Each Data Raven counter gives Runner a tag at the start of each of his or her turns.
Runner may remove a Data Raven counter by taking an action to pay 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 5 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag and a Data Raven counter. Each Data Raven counter gives Runner a tag at the start of each of his or her turns. Runner may remove a Data Raven counter by taking an action to pay 1 bit.

cards.title: Data Wall
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Data Wall 2.0
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Can't those chimps in Marketing come up with a different name? This isn't just version 2.0—it's a completely different program!"

cards.title: Databroker
cards.text: [action], [trash], 1 agenda point: Gain 10[bit].
cards.stripped_text: action, trash, 1 agenda point: Gain 10 bits.
cards.flavor: "Information does not want to be free; it wants to be liberated and expensive."

cards.title: Datapool®️ by Zetatech
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Give Runner two tags.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Give Runner two tags.
cards.flavor: The enemy of your enemy is sometimes also your enemy.

cards.title: Day Shift
cards.text: Draw two cards and gain 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Draw two cards and gain 1 bit.
cards.flavor: "I'm sick of punching the clock. I want to punch my supervisor."

cards.title: Deal with Militech
cards.text: Play only if you liberated any Research agendas this turn. Put a Militech counter on each of your icebreakers. A Militech counter gives the icebreaker it is on +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you liberated any Research agendas this turn. Put a Militech counter on each of your icebreakers. A Militech counter gives the icebreaker it is on +1 strength.

cards.title: Dedicated Response Team

cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Dedicated Response Team, it does 3 meat damage. Ignore this effect unless Runner is tagged.
cards.flavor: "Excuse me—that's my beeper."

cards.title: Deep Thought
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Thought counter. Three or more Thought counters allow you to look at the top card of R&D at the start of each of your turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Thought counter. Three or more Thought counters allow you to look at the top card of R&D at the start of each of your turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

[action]: Put 3[bit] from the bank on Department of Truth Enhancement.
[action]: Take all the bits from Department of Truth Enhancement.
cards.stripped_text: action: Put 3 bits from the bank on Department of Truth Enhancement. action: Take all the bits from Department of Truth Enhancement.
cards.flavor: "We don't lie. We use statistics." —Scott H. Warner, Department Coordinator

cards.title: Dermatech Bodyplating
cards.text: Prevents 1 meat damage each turn.
cards.stripped_text: Prevents 1 meat damage each turn.
cards.flavor: "Is that the best you can do, corp boy?"

cards.title: Desperate Competitor
cards.text: Play only if you liberated any Gray Ops agendas this turn. Score 1 agenda point.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you liberated any Gray Ops agendas this turn. Score 1 agenda point.
cards.flavor: "We appreciate that you've already promised this property to someone else, and we wouldn't expect you to compromise your honor without proper compensation."

cards.title: Detroit Police Contract

Put 12[bit] from the bank on Detroit Police Contract when you score it.
Take 2[bit] from Detroit Police Contract, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: Put 12 bits from the bank on Detroit Police Contract when you score it. Take 2 bits from Detroit Police Contract, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns.
cards.flavor: Corporate security forces are infamous for employing lethal force as a means of reducing overhead.

cards.title: Dieter Esslin
cards.text: When Runner accesses Dieter Esslin, Dieter does 1 Net damage.
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Dieter Esslin, Dieter does 1 Net damage.

cards.title: Diplomatic Immunity
cards.text: Prevents all meat damage. The Corp may pay 1 agenda point to cancel this effect until end of turn. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.
cards.stripped_text: Prevents all meat damage. The Corp may pay 1 agenda point to cancel this effect until end of turn. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

Whenever Runner makes a successful run on this fort, you may choose an ice card stored in HQ. Pay half of that card's rez cost, rounded down, to force Runner to encounter it; the run is not considered successful unless Runner passes that piece of ice. Trash that ice after the encounter ends.
Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever Runner makes a successful run on this fort, you may choose an ice card stored in HQ. cards.stripped_text: Gain three consecutive actions, which you may use only to install cards. You are not required to take all three of these actions.

cards.title: Edited Shipping Manifests

cards.stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, and the Corp has any bits when you would access HQ, do not access cards from HQ; instead, the Corp loses 1 bit and gives you a tag, and you gain 10 bits.

cards.text: Gain 3[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Gain 3 bits.
cards.flavor: Waste not, want not.

[action]: Draw two cards.

[subroutine] End the run.

[action], 1[bit]: Draw two cards.

cards.stripped_text: Put 12 bits from the bank on Holovid Campaign when you rez it. Take 1 bit from Holovid Campaign at the start of each of your turns. When all the bits have been removed, trash Holovid Campaign.

cards.title: Homewrecker™️
cards.text: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, end the run, trash a piece of hardware, and do 2 meat damage. This damage cannot be prevented.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, end the run, trash a piece of hardware, and do 2 meat damage. This damage cannot be prevented.
cards.flavor: "It does more than discourage intrusions—it keeps our fire department contract in the black."

cards.title: Hostile Takeover
cards.text: Gain 5[bit] when you score Hostile Takeover.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 5 bits when you score Hostile Takeover.
cards.flavor: "Tell the Director I'm sorry, but I can't seem to find any reference to 'intact' in the mercenaries' contract."

cards.title: Hot Tip for WNS
cards.text: Score 1 agenda point if you liberated any Black Ops agendas this turn.
cards.stripped_text: Score 1 agenda point if you liberated any Black Ops agendas this turn.
cards.flavor: "A plot to assassinate Elvis—bizarre but true, and we'll tell you all about it at eleven."

cards.title: HQ Interface
cards.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access an additional card from HQ.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access an additional card from HQ.
cards.flavor: "...from Arasaka to Cuernavaca to Oaxaca—to me the gear does come."

cards.title: Hunt Club BBS
cards.text: Expose up to three installed cards.
cards.stripped_text: Expose up to three installed cards.
cards.flavor: "The Hunt Club got its name from the original programmers, who were self-described 'hunters,' corporate programmers who moonlighted as freelance counter-intrusion agents." —Rache Bartmoss

cards.title: Hunter
cards.text: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is succesful, give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is succesful, give Runner a tag.

cards.title: I Got a Rock
cards.text: [action], 3 agenda points, Do 15 meat damage to Runner. Use this ability only if Runner has two or more tags.
cards.stripped_text: action, 3 agenda points, Do 15 meat damage to Runner. Use this ability only if Runner has two or more tags.

cards.title: I Spy
cards.text: [trash]: Put a Spy counter in a data fort. A Spy counter exposes all cards installed inside or on a fort containing it. The Corp may remove a Spy counter by taking an action to pay 4[bit]. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that fort.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Put a Spy counter in a data fort. A Spy counter exposes all cards installed inside or on a fort containing it. The Corp may remove a Spy counter by taking an action to pay 4 bits. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that fort.

cards.title: Ice and Data's Guide to the Net
cards.stripped_title: Ice and Data's Guide to the Net
cards.text: Expose the outermost ice of each data fort.
cards.stripped_text: Expose the outermost ice of each data fort.
cards.flavor: "Meet the ice without hitting the skids." —Advert

cards.title: Ice Pick Willie
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Nice 'breaker you got there. hate to see anything happen to it."

cards.title: Ice Transmutation
cards.text: Choose a piece of rezzed ice when you score Ice Transmutation. That ice now has +1 strength, and each subroutine on it is repeated once. Treat this as if each repeated subroutine appeared immediately after the original subroutine.
cards.stripped_text: Choose a piece of rezzed ice when you score Ice Transmutation. That ice now has +1 strength, and each subroutine on it is repeated once. Treat this as if each repeated subroutine appeared immediately after the original subroutine.

cards.title: If You Want It Done Right...
cards.stripped_title: If You Want It Done Right...
cards.text: Look through the top five cards of your stack. Bring one of those cards into your hand, and arrange the rest in any order you choose.
cards.stripped_text: Look through the top five cards of your stack. Bring one of those cards into your hand, and arrange the rest in any order you choose.
cards.flavor: "...you gotta do it yourself."

cards.title: Imp
cards.text: Imp can have up to 2 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in this way have their strength reduced by 1. If Imp leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.
cards.stripped_text: Imp can have up to 2 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in this way have their strength reduced by 1. If Imp leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.

cards.title: Incubator
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run, give the Corp an Incubate counter. Each Incubate counter necessitates a die roll at the start of each of your turns; on each 6, choose a Virus counter and exchange that counter for two counters of the same type.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run, give the Corp an Incubate counter. Each Incubate counter necessitates a die roll at the start of each of your turns; on each 6, choose a Virus counter and exchange that counter for two counters of the same type. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.title: Information Laundering
cards.text:
You may advance Information Laundering before and after you rez it.
[action], [trash]: Gain 4[bit] for each advancement counter on Information Laundering.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Information Laundering before and after you rez it. action, trash: Gain 4 bits for each advancement counter on Information Laundering.
cards.flavor: "Information wants to be clean."

cards.title: Inside Job
cards.text: Make a run. You automatically pass the first piece of ice you encounter during that run.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. You automatically pass the first piece of ice you encounter during that run.
cards.flavor: "Preparation beats expiration, if you ask me." —Edger

cards.title: Investment Firm
cards.text: Take 1[bit] from Investment Firm, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns. Whenever 1[bit] or more bits are added to your pool, you may put 2[bit] from the bank on Investment Firm for each 1[bit] you choose not to add to your pool. Effects that give you bits at the start of your turn cannot be used this way.
cards.stripped_text: Take 1 bit from Investment Firm, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns. Whenever 1 bit or more bits are added to your pool, you may put 2 bits from the bank on Investment Firm for each 1 bit you choose not to add to your pool. Effects that give you bits at the start of your turn cannot be used this way.

cards.title: Invisibility
cards.text: Put 1[bit] from the bank on Invisibility when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 1 bit from the bank on Invisibility when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: Jack 'n' Joe
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.stripped_text: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: "There's too much blood in my caffeine system."

cards.title: Jack Attack
cards.text:
[subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner cannot jack out.
[subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner cannot jack out. [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

cards.title: Jackhammer
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Jackhammer, lose 1[bit], if you can, from a stealth card.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break wall subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Jackhammer, lose 1 bit, if you can, from a stealth card.

cards.title: Japanese Water Torture
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
X: +X strength, and forgo your next X actions.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break wall subroutine. X: +X strength, and forgo your next X actions.

cards.title: Jenny Jett
cards.text: Whenever Runner makes a successful run on this fort, you may choose an ice card stored in HQ. Install that piece of ice on this fort in the innermost position, paying an installation cost of 1[bit] for each piece of ice already on the fort. Runner is now considered to be approaching that piece of ice. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever Runner makes a successful run on this fort, you may choose an ice card stored in HQ. Install that piece of ice on this fort in the innermost position, paying an installation cost of 1 bit for each piece of ice already on the fort. Runner is now considered to be approaching that piece of ice. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.

cards.title: Jerusalem City Grid
cards.text:
Cost to rez walls on this fort is reduced by 2[bit]. All walls on this fort have +1 strength.
Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Cost to rez walls on this fort is reduced by 2 bits. All walls on this fort have +1 strength. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Joan of Arc
cards.text:
[trash]: Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed.
1[bit]: Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed, and bring Joan of Arc into your hand.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed. 1 bit: Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed, and bring Joan of Arc into your hand.

cards.title: Junkyard BBS
cards.text: [action], 1[bit]: Bring the top card from your trash into your hand.
cards.stripped_text: action, 1 bit: Bring the top card from your trash into your hand.
cards.flavor: "You wouldn't believe the sstuff some people throw away!"

cards.title: Karl de Veres, Corporate Stooge
cards.text:
Gain 1[bit] each time you make a successful run.
Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 1 bit each time you make a successful run. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

cards.title: Keeper
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: All computers wait at the same speed.

cards.title: Kilroy Was Here
cards.text: Make a run on R&D; you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in R&D, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on R&D; you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in R&D, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
cards.flavor: "Art is a form of catharsis."

cards.title: Krash
cards.text:
2[bit]: Break ice subroutine.
2[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break ice subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength.

cards.title: Krumz
cards.text: Put 1[bit] from the bank on Krumz when you rez it. Use this bit only to pay for traces. If you use this bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 1 bit from the bank on Krumz when you rez it. Use this bit only to pay for traces. If you use this bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: Laser Wire
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 Net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 Net damage. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Leland, Corporate Bodyguard
cards.text:
1[bit]: Prevent 1 meat damage.
[trash]: Avoid receiving a tag.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Prevent 1 meat damage. trash: Avoid receiving a tag.
cards.flavor: Friends help you move. Real friends help you move bodies.

cards.title: Liche
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Lifesaver™️ Nanosurgeons
cards.text:
[action]: Draw two cards. Use this ability only if you were damaged during any of your last three actions.
[trash]: Prevent 1 brain damage.
cards.stripped_text: action: Draw two cards. Use this ability only if you were damaged during any of your last three actions. trash: Prevent 1 brain damage.

cards.title: Livewire's Contacts
cards.text: Gain 3[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Gain 3 bits.
cards.flavor: "Let's get something clear, punk. Out there, you might be a big-shot chiphead with your uptown inputs, but down here you're just another skinny geek from the wrong side of the barricades. So sit down, but me a Fizz, and let me do all the talking."

cards.title: Loan from Chiba
cards.text: Gain 12[bit] when Loan from Chiba is installed. At the start of each of your turns, lose 1[bit]. If Loan from Chiba leaves play, pay 10[bit] or lose the game. You may trash Loan from Chiba at the end of any of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 12 bits when Loan from Chiba is installed. At the start of each of your turns, lose 1 bit. If Loan from Chiba leaves play, pay 10 bits or lose the game. You may trash Loan from Chiba at the end of any of your turns.
cards.flavor: "I hear their collection agents have organ preserva-paks. And dull scalpels."

cards.title: Loony Goon
cards.text:
1[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break sentry subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "Of course you realize... this means war."

cards.title: Lucidrine™️ Booster Drug
cards.text: Make a run, and gain 9[bit], which you may use only during that run. After that run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage; this damage cannot be prevented. Then, return to the bank any of the 9[bit] not spent.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run, and gain 9 bits, which you may use only during that run. After that run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage; this damage cannot be prevented. Then, return to the bank any of the 9 bits not spent.

cards.title: Main-Office Relocation
cards.text: Hand size +2
cards.stripped_text: Hand size +2
cards.flavor: Corporate relocation efforts have become a much riskier proposition since the advent of the corporate war. Often, a corp's security teams will have to arrange armored convoys to prevent thefts.

cards.title: Management Shake-Up
cards.text: Add three advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.stripped_text: Add three advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.flavor: Don't be irreplaceable, if you can't be replaced, you can't be promoted.

cards.title: Mantis, Fixer-at-Large
cards.text: Search your stack for a card, and bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.
cards.stripped_text: Search your stack for a card, and bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.
cards.flavor: "Yeah, I can get it for you, and if you want me to break a few fingers, I'll throw that in for free."

cards.title: Marine Arcology
cards.text: [action], [action]: Gain 3[bit].
cards.stripped_text: action, action: Gain 3 bits.
cards.flavor: "We could have accepted that bid, but in Nipponese wet real estate there're ultimately two kinds of construction: tsunami spec... and bait bucket."

cards.title: Mastiff
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 Net damage.
[subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all ice is encountered at +1 strength.
[subroutine] -If trace is successful, give Runner a Mastiff counter. Each Mastiff counter does 1 brain damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Mastiff counter by taking an action to spend 4[bit].
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Do 1 Net damage. [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all ice is encountered at +1 strength. [subroutine] -If trace is successful, give Runner a Mastiff counter. Each Mastiff counter does 1 brain damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Mastiff counter by taking an action to spend 4 bits. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Mazer
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Some Greek software house makes a variant that includes a killer with a minotaur motif. If you take too long to get through, it sics the minotaur on you, instead of cutting your connection. Lame clichés never die, I guess." —Spider Murphy

cards.title: Microtech 'Trode Set
cards.text: Pay 1[bit], in addition to the normal cost, to break each ice subroutine. Ignore all AP subroutines except those that trace, or that do Net damage. Prevents all but 1 Net damage from each AP subroutine you do not break.
cards.stripped_text: Pay 1 bit, in addition to the normal cost, to break each ice subroutine. Ignore all AP subroutines except those that trace, or that do Net damage. Prevents all but 1 Net damage from each AP subroutine you do not break.

cards.title: Microtech AI Interface
cards.text: Whenever you are about to access cards from R&D, you may first choose to cut any number of cards from the top of R&D to the bottom of R&D.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you are about to access cards from R&D, you may first choose to cut any number of cards from the top of R&D to the bottom of R&D.

cards.title: Microtech Backup Drive
cards.text:
Whenever one or more installed programs are being sent to the trash at the same time, you may instead choose to put any or all of the programs on top of Microtech Backup Drive in any order you choose. If Backup Drive is removed from play, trash any cards on it.
[action]: Bring the top card on Backup Drive into your hand.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever one or more installed programs are being sent to the trash at the same time, you may instead choose to put any or all of the programs on top of Microtech Backup Drive in any order you choose. If Backup Drive is removed from play, trash any cards on it. action: Bring the top card on Backup Drive into your hand.

cards.title: Militech MRAM Chip
cards.text: Hand size +3
cards.stripped_text: Hand size +3
cards.flavor: "I have a hard time remembering, when the chips are down."

cards.title: misc.for-sale
cards.text: Trash any number of your installed cards. Gain 3[bit] for each card trashed in this way.
cards.stripped_text: Trash any number of your installed cards. Gain 3 bits for each card trashed in this way.
cards.flavor: "Why throw it away when you can convince some half-brained weef to use it for creative suicide instead?" —Rache Bartmoss

cards.title: MIT West Tier
cards.text: Shuffle your hand, trash, and stack together, and then draw five cards. When you play MIT West Tier, remove it from the game instead of trashing it.
cards.stripped_text: Shuffle your hand, trash, and stack together, and then draw five cards. When you play MIT West Tier, remove it from the game instead of trashing it.

cards.title: Mouse
cards.text: [action]: Expose a card installed inside a data fort.
cards.stripped_text: action: Expose a card installed inside a data fort.
cards.flavor: "If a man... make a better mousetrap than his neighbor, tho' he build his house in the woods, the world will make a beaten path to his door." —Ralph Waldo Emerson, quoted by Sarah S.B. Yule, Borrowings

cards.title: MRAM Chip
cards.text: Hand size +2
cards.stripped_text: Hand size +2
cards.flavor: "Your brain's just like any other appliance, chummer. Works better if you plug it in." —Joey Two-Tails

cards.title: Mystery Box
cards.text: 0[bit]: Show the top five cards of your stack to the Corp. If any of those cards are programs, trash Mystery Box and then install one of those programs, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run and only once each run.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Show the top five cards of your stack to the Corp. If any of those cards are programs, trash Mystery Box and then install one of those programs, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run and only once each run.

cards.title: N.E.T.O.
cards.text: [action]: Look at the top four cards of your stack. You may bring any prep or resource cards among them into your hand. Pay 1[bit] for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack.
cards.stripped_text: action: Look at the top four cards of your stack. You may bring any prep or resource cards among them into your hand. Pay 1 bit for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack.

cards.title: Namatoki Plaza
cards.text: Rez Namatoki Plaza when you install it. Install Namatoki Plaza only if you can pay to rez it. Install only inside a subsidiary data fort. That fort may have an additional agenda or node installed inside it. If Namatoki Plaza leaves play while installed, and this results in the fort having too many agendas and nodes installed inside it, trash one of those agendas or nodes.
cards.stripped_text: Rez Namatoki Plaza when you install it. Install Namatoki Plaza only if you can pay to rez it. Install only inside a subsidiary data fort. That fort may have an additional agenda or node installed inside it. If Namatoki Plaza leaves play while installed, and this results in the fort having too many agendas and nodes installed inside it, trash one of those agendas or nodes.

cards.title: Nasuko Cycle
cards.text: 3[bit]: Avoid receiving a tag.
cards.stripped_text: 3 bits: Avoid receiving a tag.
cards.flavor: Puts the world into fast forward so you can skip the scenes that ain't so pretty.

cards.title: Nerve Labyrinth
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor:
"If you're authorized, it's a smooth ride through; if you're not, you get the brain-twist of someone else's idea of normalcy." —Spider Murphy
"But it's a great training ground for navigating wilderspace." —Rache Bartmoss

cards.title: Netspace Inverter
cards.text: Reverse a fort's ice cards so that the outermost piece of ice becomes the innermost piece of ice, and so forth. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that data fort.
cards.stripped_text: Reverse a fort's ice cards so that the outermost piece of ice becomes the innermost piece of ice, and so forth. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that data fort.

cards.title: Netwatch Credit Voucher
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Give Runner a tag, and gain 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Give Runner a tag, and gain 1 bit.

cards.title: Netwatch Operations Office
cards.text: [action]:Trace 2 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: action:Trace 2 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.flavor: "These Netwatch goons are okay, but I'm thinking we should have started our own police program instead."

cards.title: Neural Blade
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 Net damage.
[subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 Net damage. [subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.

cards.title: Nevinyrral
cards.text:
Gain an action during each of your turns.
If Nevinyrral leaves play while rezzed, you lose the game.
Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.
cards.stripped_text: Gain an action during each of your turns. If Nevinyrral leaves play while rezzed, you lose the game. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

cards.title: New Blood
cards.text: Conceal all revealed but unrezzed ice; then rearrange your installed ice by swapping pairs of ice while Runner looks away.
cards.stripped_text: Conceal all revealed but unrezzed ice; then rearrange your installed ice by swapping pairs of ice while Runner looks away.
cards.flavor: "I hate newbie sysops. They always rearrange our ice into some weird configuration just because it matches some stupid question on their finals."

cards.title: New Galveston City Grid
cards.text:
All nodes and other upgrades installed inside this fort cost 2[bit], in addition to the normal cost, to trash.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: All nodes and other upgrades installed inside this fort cost 2 bits, in addition to the normal cost, to trash. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Newsgroup Filter
cards.text: [action]: Gain 2[bit].
cards.stripped_text: action: Gain 2 bits.
cards.flavor: You can find some useful stuff in the newsgroups if you can enlist on AI with the patience to wade through all the garbage.

cards.title: Newsgroup Taunting
cards.text: At the start of each run, Runner must pay 1[bit], in addition to any other costs, or end the run.
cards.stripped_text: At the start of each run, Runner must pay 1 bit, in addition to any other costs, or end the run.

cards.title: Night Shift
cards.text: Gain 2[bit] and draw one card.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 2 bits and draw one card.
cards.flavor: "It wasn't until my certification boards that it began to dawn on me that nights aren't infinitely long."

cards.title: Nomad Allies
cards.text:
[action], 1[bit]: Remove a tag, at no cost.
[trash]: Avoid receiving a tag.
cards.stripped_text: action, 1 bit: Remove a tag, at no cost. trash: Avoid receiving a tag.
cards.flavor: "So, what are we calling you this month?"

cards.title: Off-Site Backups
cards.text: Bring any card from the Archives into HQ.
cards.stripped_text: Bring any card from the Archives into HQ.
cards.flavor: Data saved is eurobucks earned.

cards.title: Olivia Salazar
cards.text: For half cost, rounded down, rez a piece of ice installed on this fort. Derez that ice at the end of the run. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: For half cost, rounded down, rez a piece of ice installed on this fort. Derez that ice at the end of the run. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.

cards.title: Omni Kismet, Ph.D.
cards.text: Swap a piece of unrezzed ice on this fort with an ice card stored in HQ. The new ice card comes into play concealed. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: Swap a piece of unrezzed ice on this fort with an ice card stored in HQ. The new ice card comes into play concealed. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.
