cards.title: Omniscience Foundation
cards.text: Give Runner a tag at the end of each turn during which Runner received a tag.
cards.stripped_text: Give Runner a tag at the end of each turn during which Runner received a tag.

cards.title: On-Call Solo Team
cards.text: [action]: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.stripped_text: action: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.flavor: "Corporate solo teams operate much like government death squads, with the primary difference being that solo teams aren't clumsy enough to let themselves be exposed."

cards.title: Open-Ended®️ Mileage Program
cards.text: Remove a tag, at no cost. You may pay 1[bit] when you play Open-Ended®️ Mileage Program to take it back into your hand instead of trashing it.
cards.stripped_text: Remove a tag, at no cost. You may pay 1 bit when you play Open-Ended Mileage Program to take it back into your hand instead of trashing it.

cards.title: Organ Donor
cards.text: Trash up to five cards from your hand. Gain 2[bit] for each card trashed in this way.
cards.stripped_text: Trash up to five cards from your hand. Gain 2 bits for each card trashed in this way.
cards.flavor: "I really need the scratch, and well, I do have two of them...."

cards.title: Overtime Incentives
cards.text: Gain two actions.
cards.stripped_text: Gain two actions.
cards.flavor: "Hey, the door is stuck."

cards.title: Pacifica Regional AI
cards.text:
You may advance Pacifica Regional AI before and after you rez it.
Regional AI Advancement counter: Gain an action.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Pacifica Regional AI before and after you rez it. Regional AI Advancement counter: Gain an action.

cards.title: Pandora's Deck
cards.text:
Provides +2 MU.
Put 3[bit] from the bank on Pandora's Deck when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +2 MU. Put 3 bits from the bank on Pandora's Deck when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Paris City Grid
cards.text:
Put 3[bit] from the bank on Paris City Grid when you rez it. Use these bits only to pay for traces made during runs on this fort. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Put 3 bits from the bank on Paris City Grid when you rez it. Use these bits only to pay for traces made during runs on this fort. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Parraline 5750
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU.
Put 1[bit] from the bank on Parraline 5750 when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU. Put 1 bit from the bank on Parraline 5750 when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Pattel's Virus
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pattel counter on a piece of ice that had all its subroutines broken during that run. Each Pattel counter on a piece of ice reduces its strength by 1.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pattel counter on a piece of ice that had all its subroutines broken during that run. Each Pattel counter on a piece of ice reduces its strength by 1. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.title: Pile Driver
cards.text:
3[bit]: Break up to four wall subroutines on a single piece of ice.
1[bit]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Pile Driver's break-walls subroutine, lose a total of 3[bit] from stealth cards.
cards.stripped_text: 3 bits: Break up to four wall subroutines on a single piece of ice. 1 bit: +1 strength. Whenever you use Pile Driver's break-walls subroutine, lose a total of 3 bits from stealth cards.

cards.title: PK-6089a
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU.
Put 3[bit] from the bank on PK-6089a when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU. Put 3 bits from the bank on PK-6089a when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.flavor: "Hey, this sucker can keep your deadline from becoming a flatline." —Dog

cards.title: Planning Consultants
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of R&D and arrange them in any order you choose.
cards.stripped_text: Look at the top five cards of R&D and arrange them in any order you choose.
cards.flavor: "Chance favors the prepared mind." —Sir Isaac Newton

cards.title: Playful AI
cards.text: Roll a die. On a 1, 2, or 3, gain that many bits, set aside that many dice to roll again, or choose some combination thereof. Repeat until you have rolled all the dice you set aside.
cards.stripped_text: Roll a die. On a 1, 2, or 3, gain that many bits, set aside that many dice to roll again, or choose some combination thereof. Repeat until you have rolled all the dice you set aside.
cards.flavor: "Gaming is a mode of transferring properly without producing any intermediate good." —Samuel Johnson

cards.title: Pocket Virtual Reality
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trace 6-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
[subroutine] Trace 6-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Whenever Pocket Virtual Reality is encountered, gain 4[bit].
Use these bits only to pay for the above traces. When the encounter ends, return to the bank any of the 4[bit] you did not spend.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 6-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. [subroutine] Trace 6-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Whenever Pocket Virtual Reality is encountered, gain 4 bits. Use these bits only to pay for the above traces. When the encounter ends, return to the bank any of the 4 bits you did not spend.

cards.title: Political Coup
cards.text:
Put 12[bit] from the bank on Political Coup when you score it.
[action]: Take 3[bit] from Political Coup, if it has any bits.
cards.stripped_text: Put 12 bits from the bank on Political Coup when you score it. action: Take 3 bits from Political Coup, if it has any bits.
cards.flavor: "Assassination is the extreme form of censorship." —George Bernard Shaw, The Rejected Statement

cards.title: Political Overthrow
cards.text: [action]: Gain 3[bit].
cards.stripped_text: action: Gain 3 bits.
cards.flavor: "You know, these small island countries are becoming less and less of a challenge."

cards.title: Poltergeist
cards.text: Put 2[bit] on Poltergeist when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing nodes. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits on Poltergeist when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing nodes. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: Polymer Breakthrough
cards.text: Gain 1[bit] at the start of each of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 1 bit at the start of each of your turns.

cards.title: Power Grid Overload
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Trash X pieces of hardware, other than cybernetics.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Trash X pieces of hardware, other than cybernetics.

cards.title: Pox
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pox counter in the fort that was run. Every two Pox counters in a fort require the Corp to pay 1[bit], in addition to any other costs, to install a card inside or on that fort.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pox counter in the fort that was run. Every two Pox counters in a fort require the Corp to pay 1 bit, in addition to any other costs, to install a card inside or on that fort. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.title: Preying Mantis
cards.text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action. If you do, suffer 1 brain damage at the end of the turn. This damage cannot be prevented.
cards.stripped_text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action. If you do, suffer 1 brain damage at the end of the turn. This damage cannot be prevented.
cards.flavor: "First hit's free!"

cards.title: Priority Requisition
cards.text: You may rez a piece of ice, at no cost, when you score Priority Requisition.
cards.stripped_text: You may rez a piece of ice, at no cost, when you score Priority Requisition.
cards.flavor: "I just gave the big guy a rundown of last month's security breaches, and bingo! we've got a new budget."

cards.title: Priority Wreck
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, pay any number of bits to force the Corp to lose that many bits.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, pay any number of bits to force the Corp to lose that many bits.
cards.flavor: "Your personal icon is unrecognized, Chairman; I cannot process this file. Please input authorization code within—Thank you. Filename 'Suckers!' overwrite of HQ datacore commencing as requested."

cards.title: Private Cybernet Police
cards.text: [action]:Trace 5 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: action:Trace 5 -If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
cards.flavor: "Seen a pink panda about yay high come through this BBS lately? No? Well, here's my hypercard anyway; if you notice anything unusual, just drop me a line."

cards.title: Private LDL Access
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, treat run as a successful run on R&D.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, treat run as a successful run on R&D.

cards.title: Project Babylon
cards.text: Score 1 additional agenda point for every two advancement counters over Project Babylon's difficulty that are on Project Babylon when you score it.
cards.stripped_text: Score 1 additional agenda point for every two advancement counters over Project Babylon's difficulty that are on Project Babylon when you score it.

cards.title: Project Consultants
cards.text: Add four advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.stripped_text: Add four advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.

cards.title: Punitive Counterstrike
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 2 meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 2 meat damage.
cards.flavor: "Violence isn't always the best approach, but it's often the most direct." —Anonymous WuTech VP

cards.title: Quandary
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "So many decisions, so little ti—"

cards.title: Quest for Cattekin
cards.text: At the start of each of your turns, roll a die. On a 6, trash Quest for Cattekin, and you gain an action on each of your turns for the remainder of the game. On a 1, suffer 1 brain damage. On a 2, suffer 1 Net damage. Damage from Quest for Cattekin cannot be prevented.
cards.stripped_text: At the start of each of your turns, roll a die. On a 6, trash Quest for Cattekin, and you gain an action on each of your turns for the remainder of the game. On a 1, suffer 1 brain damage. On a 2, suffer 1 Net damage. Damage from Quest for Cattekin cannot be prevented.

cards.title: R&D Interface
cards.text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access an additional card from R&D.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access an additional card from R&D.
cards.flavor: "I have a friend in Oaxaca who sells to Ops in Cuernavaca who supply a tech at Arasaka..."

cards.title: R&D-Protocol Files
cards.text: [action]: Make a run on R&D, but instead of accessing cards, look at the top five cards of R&D.
cards.stripped_text: action: Make a run on R&D, but instead of accessing cards, look at the top five cards of R&D.

cards.title: Rabbit
cards.text: Ice that attempts to trace you has its trace limit reduced by 1.
cards.stripped_text: Ice that attempts to trace you has its trace limit reduced by 1.

cards.title: Raffles
cards.text:
1[bit]: Break code gate subroutine.
2[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break code gate subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength

cards.title: Ramming Piston
cards.text:
2[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Ramming Piston, lose a total of 2[bit] from stealth cards.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break wall subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Ramming Piston, lose a total of 2 bits from stealth cards.

cards.title: Raptor
cards.text:
2[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break sentry subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength
cards.flavor: "There's nothing quite like the screech of a Raptor echoing through the data halls as it sweeps in for a kill." —Kiyote

cards.title: Raven Microcyb Eagle
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU.
Prevents 1 Net damage each turn.
Put 1[bit] from the bank on Microcyb Eagle when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU. Prevents 1 Net damage each turn. Put 1 bit from the bank on Microcyb Eagle when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Raven Microcyb Owl
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU.
Put 3[bit] from the bank on Microcyb Owl when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU. Put 3 bits from the bank on Microcyb Owl when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Razor Wire
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Record Reconstructor
cards.text: [action]: Make a run on the Archives. If run is successful, do not access cards from the Archives; instead, shuffle the face-up pile of the Archives and then put the top two cards from that pile on R&D.
cards.stripped_text: action: Make a run on the Archives. If run is successful, do not access cards from the Archives; instead, shuffle the face-up pile of the Archives and then put the top two cards from that pile on R&D.

cards.title: Red Herrings
cards.text: Runner must pay 5[bit], in addition to any other costs, to steal agendas accessed from this fort, even on the run during which Runner trashes Red Herrings.
cards.stripped_text: Runner must pay 5 bits, in addition to any other costs, to steal agendas accessed from this fort, even on the run during which Runner trashes Red Herrings.
cards.flavor: "Frack! It's easier to find things on my floor than in this mess."

cards.title: Reflector
cards.text: 0[bit]: Break stun, hellbolt, or knockout subroutine.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break stun, hellbolt, or knockout subroutine.
cards.flavor: "This icebreaker is basically a last-ditch defense for when your Killers aren't getting the job done. It takes advantage of a design flaw in these sorts of ice to reflect their unique signal back at them, crashing their detection routines." —Digital Dana

cards.title: Reinforced Wall
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Remote Facility
cards.text: Gain an action during each of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: Gain an action during each of your turns.
cards.flavor: "While moving corporate operations to a remote location increases processing costs, it becomes easier to defend vital information against attempts at hostile acquisition." —David Samms, corporate consultant

cards.title: Replicator
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break ice subroutine that traces.
1[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break ice subroutine that traces. 1 bit: +1 strength

cards.title: Rescheduler
cards.text: [action]: Note the number of cards stored in HQ. Shuffle those cards into R&D, and then draw that many cards.
cards.stripped_text: action: Note the number of cards stored in HQ. Shuffle those cards into R&D, and then draw that many cards.

cards.title: Restrictive Net Zoning
cards.text: Choose a data fort when Restrictive Net Zoning is installed. The Corp must pay 2[bit], in addition to the normal cost, to install ice on that fort.
cards.stripped_text: Choose a data fort when Restrictive Net Zoning is installed. The Corp must pay 2 bits, in addition to the normal cost, to install ice on that fort.
cards.flavor: Corporations wishing to conduct business here should consider the cost of getting intrusion countermeasures to blend with the high-rez scenary of an AW-1 (Alice in Wonderland) Zone.

cards.title: Rex
cards.text: [subroutine] Trace 3-If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay 2[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 3-If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay 2 bits.

cards.title: Rigged Investments
cards.text:
Put 12[bit] from the bank on Rigged Investments when it is installed.
At the start of each of your turns, take 1[bit] from Investments. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rigged Investments.
cards.stripped_text: Put 12 bits from the bank on Rigged Investments when it is installed. At the start of each of your turns, take 1 bit from Investments. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rigged Investments.

cards.title: Rio de Janeiro City Grid
cards.text:
Roll a die whenever Runner passes a piece of rezzed ice during a run on this fort. On a 1, end the run.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Roll a die whenever Runner passes a piece of rezzed ice during a run on this fort. On a 1, end the run. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.flavor: "There's a new jungle in Brazil—the rusted-wire maze of telecom retrotech. Prepare to have your line dropped, and dropped, and dropped, and..."

cards.title: Rock is Strong
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "I hear we have to watch out for a new icebreaker called 'Paper is True.'"

cards.title: Rockerboy Promotion
cards.text:
Put 15[bit] from the bank on Rockerboy Promotion when you rez it. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rockerboy Promotion.
[action]: Take 3[bit] from Rockerboy Promotion.
cards.stripped_text: Put 15 bits from the bank on Rockerboy Promotion when you rez it. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rockerboy Promotion. action: Take 3 bits from Rockerboy Promotion.

cards.title: Romp through HQ
cards.text: Make a run on HQ; you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on HQ; you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
cards.flavor: "I love the sound of screaming crystal. Sadly, I seem to be the only one to hear it." —Rache Bartmoss

cards.title: Ronin Around
cards.text:
[action]: Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any hardware cards among them into your hand. Pay 1[bit] for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack.
[action], 2[bit]: Expose any card.
cards.stripped_text: action: Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any hardware cards among them into your hand. Pay 1 bit for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack. action, 2 bits: Expose any card.

cards.title: Roving Submarine
cards.text:
Install only inside a subsidiary data fort. This fort may be run only if you installed or advanced a card inside or on this fort during your last turn.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Install only inside a subsidiary data fort. This fort may be run only if you installed or advanced a card inside or on this fort during your last turn. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Rustbelt HQ Branch
cards.text: Hand size +2
cards.stripped_text: Hand size +2
cards.flavor: "'Systems are heavily monitored, and computer crime treated with draconian ferocity.' Sounds like Heaven."

cards.title: Scatter Shot
cards.text: Put 2[bit] from the bank on Scatter Shot when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing upgrades. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits from the bank on Scatter Shot when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing upgrades. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: Schlaghund
cards.text: [action]: Roll a die. If you roll less than or equal to the number of tags Runner has, Schlaghund does 10 meat damage and you trash Schlaghund.
cards.stripped_text: action: Roll a die. If you roll less than or equal to the number of tags Runner has, Schlaghund does 10 meat damage and you trash Schlaghund.
cards.flavor: "Remember when your mother told you not to pet strange dogs? That's advice to live by."

cards.title: Scorched Earth
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 4 meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 4 meat damage.

cards.title: Score!
cards.text: Gain 9[bit]
cards.stripped_text: Gain 9 bits
cards.flavor: "If someone has consistently good luck, it ain't luck." —Spider Murphy

cards.title: Scramble
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Security Code WORM Chip
cards.text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Trash a piece of unrezzed ice.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Trash a piece of unrezzed ice.

cards.title: Security Net Optimization
cards.text: Choose a fort when you score Security Net Optimization. That fort gives all ice installed on it +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: Choose a fort when you score Security Net Optimization. That fort gives all ice installed on it +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "Obsolete? Upgrade it... yesterday."

cards.title: Security Purge
cards.text: Show the top three cards of R&D to Runner when you score Security Purge. If any of those cards are ice, install and rez them, at no cost. Trash the rest of those cards.
cards.stripped_text: Show the top three cards of R&D to Runner when you score Security Purge. If any of those cards are ice, install and rez them, at no cost. Trash the rest of those cards.

cards.title: SeeYa
cards.text: [action], 1[bit]: Expose an installed card.
cards.stripped_text: action, 1 bit: Expose an installed card.
cards.flavor: "It's like a pair of magic specs." —Urza Bloodrunner

cards.title: Self-Modifying Code
cards.text: [trash]: Search your stack for a program and install that program, if you can. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Search your stack for a program and install that program, if you can. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run.
cards.flavor: "Now, if I could just do this with my DNA... on the fly... while eating." —Rache Bartmoss

cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Setup!, it does 2 Net damage, even if it is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses it from the Archives. If Setup! is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

1[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.

cards.stripped_text: Prevents up to 2 Net damage each turn.

[action]: Take 2[bit] from Short-Term Contract.

cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: +2 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.

cards.stripped_text: action: Gain 1 bit and draw one card.

cards.text: If any agendas were stolen during Runner's last turn, gain bits equal to three times the number of advancement counters those agendas had.
cards.stripped_text: If any agendas were stolen during Runner's last turn, gain bits equal to three times the number of advancement counters those agendas had.

Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Swap a piece of unrezzed ice on this fort with an ice card stored in HQ. The new ice card comes into play concealed. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Skälderviken SA Beta Test Site
cards.text: Cost to rez black ice is reduced by 2[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Cost to rez black ice is reduced by 2 bits.
cards.flavor: "When you rez this, it's very important you have its administrator be there for it to imprint on him."

cards.title: Skivviss
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Skivviss counter. Each Skivviss counter requires the Corp to draw one extra card at the start of each of its turns.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Skivviss counter. Each Skivviss counter requires the Corp to draw one extra card at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

cards.title: Sleeper
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Smarteye
cards.text: Once during each run, you may expose a piece of unrezzed ice as you approach it. You may then jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.
cards.stripped_text: Once during each run, you may expose a piece of unrezzed ice as you approach it. You may then jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.

cards.title: Smith's Pawnshop
cards.text:
At the start of each of your turns, you may trash one of your other installed cards to gain 2[bit].
Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.
cards.stripped_text: At the start of each of your turns, you may trash one of your other installed cards to gain 2 bits. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

cards.title: Sneak Preview
cards.text: Choose a program from your trash or search your stack for a program. Install that program, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. At the end of the turn, take the program into your hand.
cards.stripped_text: Choose a program from your trash or search your stack for a program. Install that program, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. At the end of the turn, take the program into your hand.

cards.title: Snowball
cards.text:
Snowball has +1 strength for each subroutine it has broken during a run, until the end of that run.
1[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: Snowball has +1 strength for each subroutine it has broken during a run, until the end of that run. 1 bit: Break sentry subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength.

cards.title: Social Engineering
cards.text: Hide at least 2 from your pool in your hand; the Corp then guesses how many bits you hid. If the Corp guesses correctly, lose that many bits. Otherwise, choose a data fort and a piece of ice on that fort. Then make a run on that fort, during which you automatically pass that piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: Hide at least 2 from your pool in your hand; the Corp then guesses how many bits you hid. If the Corp guesses correctly, lose that many bits. Otherwise, choose a data fort and a piece of ice on that fort. Then make a run on that fort, during which you automatically pass that piece of ice.

cards.title: Solo Squad
cards.text: [action]: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.stripped_text: action: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.flavor: "We don't break kneecaps. We derm the perps with a mushroom derivative. It's more fun, more humane... and much more devastating to their fine reflexes and thus their careers."

cards.title: South African Mining Corp
cards.text: [action], [action], [action]: Gain 6[bit].
cards.stripped_text: action, action, action: Gain 6 bits.

cards.title: Speed Trap
cards.text: 0[bit]: Jack out before an upgrade or node takes effect. Use this ability only immediately after the Corp has rezzed that upgrade or node.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Jack out before an upgrade or node takes effect. Use this ability only immediately after the Corp has rezzed that upgrade or node.
cards.flavor: This program is solely intended for emergency extrication from hazards presented during inadvertent trespass; it in no way is intended to encourage willful trespass or other illegal action. ("Yeah, right.")

cards.title: Spinn®️ Public Relations
cards.text:
Take 1[bit] from Spinn®️ Public Relations, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns.
[action]: Put 3[bit] from the bank on Spinn®️ Public Relations.
cards.stripped_text: Take 1 bit from Spinn Public Relations, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns. action: Put 3 bits from the bank on Spinn Public Relations.
cards.flavor: "Of course it's true! I saw it on the 'vid."

cards.title: Startup Immolator
cards.text: [trash]: Pay the rez cost of a piece of ice to trash that piece of ice. Use this ability only if you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Pay the rez cost of a piece of ice to trash that piece of ice. Use this ability only if you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice.

cards.title: Strike Force Kali
cards.text: [action]: Do 2 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.stripped_text: action: Do 2 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.flavor: "What's it mean? Kali's a hellacious goddess of destruction with multiple hands—you figure it out."

cards.title: Stumble through Wilderspace
cards.text: Make a run. You have +9 link for every trace attempt made during that run.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. You have +9 link for every trace attempt made during that run.
cards.flavor: "So I guess what Wilderspace really is to me is the Net in the raw." —Edger, "Wilderspace is Nothing"

cards.title: Submarine Uplink
cards.text:
0[bit]: Base link 4.
1[bit]: +1 link.
You may use Submarine Uplink only during a run.
Using Submarine Uplink forces you to jack out after the current encounter ends.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Base link 4. 1 bit: +1 link. You may use Submarine Uplink only during a run. Using Submarine Uplink forces you to jack out after the current encounter ends. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

cards.title: Subsidiary Branch
cards.text: Gain an action during each of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: Gain an action during each of your turns.
cards.flavor: "It's an off-site location for our creative talent; we call it 'the bomb shelter from bureaucracy.'"

cards.title: Succubus
cards.text: Succubus can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. If Succubus leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.
cards.stripped_text: Succubus can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. If Succubus leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.
cards.flavor: "Hey, server..."

cards.title: Superior Net Barriers
cards.text:
All walls have +1 strength.
When you score Superior Net Barriers, reveal as many walls as you  wish. Then, gain 1[bit] for each revealed or rezzed wall.
cards.stripped_text: All walls have +1 strength. When you score Superior Net Barriers, reveal as many walls as you wish. Then, gain 1 bit for each revealed or rezzed wall.

cards.title: Synchronized Attack on HQ
cards.text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. The Corp discards all cards. The Corp can retain cards by paying 2[bit] for each card not discarded.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. The Corp discards all cards. The Corp can retain cards by paying 2 bits for each card not discarded.
cards.flavor: "You just take out the guards. Let me worry about the doors and elevators."

cards.title: Systematic Layoffs
cards.text: Add two advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.stripped_text: Add two advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.flavor: "Yes, but what have you done for us this week?"

cards.title: Team Restructuring
cards.text: Add one advancement counter to each of up to two installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.stripped_text: Add one advancement counter to each of up to two installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.flavor: Executive ability is deciding quickly and getting somebody else to do the work.

cards.title: Technician Lover
cards.text: [action]: Look at the top card of R&D.
cards.stripped_text: action: Look at the top card of R&D.
cards.flavor: "Enough about me. How's work?"

cards.title: Techtronica™️ Utility Suit
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU.
Prevents 1 meat damage each turn.
Put 5[bit] on Techtronica™️ Utility Suit when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU. Prevents 1 meat damage each turn. Put 5 bits on Techtronica Utility Suit when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Temple Microcode Outlet
cards.text: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.
cards.stripped_text: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.

cards.title: Terrorist Reprisal
cards.text: Play only if the Corp scored any Black Ops agendas during its last turn. The Corp discards five cards at random.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if the Corp scored any Black Ops agendas during its last turn. The Corp discards five cards at random.
cards.flavor:
"So what did you tell Hiro when he asked if you'd accept half?"
"I said, 'No problem. Which half of your daughter do you want back?'"

cards.title: Tesseract Fort Construction
cards.text: All ice on this fort has an additional subroutine, "[subroutine] End the run unless Runner pays 1[bit]," after all other subroutines.
cards.stripped_text: All ice on this fort has an additional subroutine, [subroutine] End the run unless Runner pays 1 bit, after all other subroutines.
cards.flavor:
"So are you upside down, or am I?"
"Depends on how you look at it."

cards.title: The Shell Traders
cards.text:
[action]: Choose a program or hardware card from your hand. Set that card aside, and put a number of Shell counters on it equal to its installation cost. When the last Shell counter on that card has been removed, install that card, at no cost. Remove one Shell counter from one card at the start of each of your turns.
1[bit]: Remove one Shell counter from a card.
cards.stripped_text: action: Choose a program or hardware card from your hand. Set that card aside, and put a number of Shell counters on it equal to its installation cost. When the last Shell counter on that card has been removed, install that card, at no cost. Remove one Shell counter from one card at the start of each of your turns. 1 bit: Remove one Shell counter from a card.

cards.title: The Short Circuit
cards.text: [action], 1[bit]: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.
cards.stripped_text: action, 1 bit: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.

cards.title: The Springboard
cards.text: 1[bit]: +1 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: +1 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.
cards.flavor: "Blow 600 eb or risk blowing your cortex—it's your choice." —Springboard advertisement

cards.title: Tinweasel
cards.text: 0[bit]: Break code gate subroutine.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break code gate subroutine.
cards.flavor: "Why, yes, I do speak fluent Navajo."

cards.title: TKO 2.0
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run, and Runner forgoes his or her next action.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run, and Runner forgoes his or her next action.
cards.flavor: "There's nothing like a right hook to the left side of your brain to throw you for a loop." —Digital Dana

cards.title: Tokyo-Chiba Infighting
cards.text:
Gain 2[bit] after each unsuccessful run on this fort.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 2 bits after each unsuccessful run on this fort. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Too Many Doors
cards.text: [subroutine] Secretly spend 0[bit], 1[bit], or 2[bit]; Runner does the same. Then you and Runner reveal how much each of you spent. End the run unless you spent as many bits as Runner spent.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Secretly spend 0 bits, 1 bit, or 2 bits; Runner does the same. Then you and Runner reveal how much each of you spent. End the run unless you spent as many bits as Runner spent.

cards.title: Top Runner's Conference
cards.text: Gain 2[bit] at the start of each of your turns. Trash Top Runners' Conference when you make a run.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 2 bits at the start of each of your turns. Trash Top Runners' Conference when you make a run.
cards.flavor: "I have discovered a truly elegant codebreaking routine. Unfortunately, this chip is not large enough to contain it."

cards.title: Total Genetic Retrofit
cards.text: Remove all tags, at no cost, and automatically avoid receiving your next tag.
cards.stripped_text: Remove all tags, at no cost, and automatically avoid receiving your next tag.
cards.flavor: "Twenty years ago it would have been just a new set of fingerprints."

cards.title: TRAP!
cards.text:
If you pay 4[bit] when Runner accesses TRAP!, it does 3 Net damage and gives Runner a tag, even if TRAP! is not installed.
Ignore this effect if Runner accesses it from the Archives.
If TRAP! is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
cards.stripped_text: If you pay 4 bits when Runner accesses TRAP!, it does 3 Net damage and gives Runner a tag, even if TRAP! is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses it from the Archives. If TRAP! is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

cards.title: Trauma Team™️
cards.text:
Put two Trauma counters on Trauma Team™️ when it is installed. 
Trauma Counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
[action]: Put one Trauma counter on Trauma Team™️.
cards.stripped_text: Put two Trauma counters on Trauma Team when it is installed.  Trauma Counter: Prevent 1 meat damage. action: Put one Trauma counter on Trauma Team.

cards.title: Triggerman
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Sweetheart, the emotional processing of two lonely ROM constructs isn't allocated a megabyte of RAM in this crazy world."

cards.title: Trojan Horse
cards.text: Play only if Runner stole any agendas during his or her last turn. Give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner stole any agendas during his or her last turn. Give Runner a tag.
cards.flavor: The high-tech equivalent of a teller slipping a paint bomb into a money bag.

cards.title: Turbeau Delacroix
cards.text: Trace 10-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Use this ability only when Runner accesses Turbeau Delacroix, and only once during each run on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: Trace 10-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Use this ability only when Runner accesses Turbeau Delacroix, and only once during each run on this fort.

cards.title: Tutor
cards.text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all ice encountered has an additional subroutine, "[subroutine] End the run," after all other subroutines.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all ice encountered has an additional subroutine, [subroutine] End the run, after all other subroutines.

cards.title: Twenty-Four-Hour Surveillance
cards.text: During runs on this fort, Runner cannot use bits from stealth sources.
cards.stripped_text: During runs on this fort, Runner cannot use bits from stealth sources.

cards.title: Tycho Extension
cards.flavor: "Of course I fired him for playing games on duty! We can't have our sysops idling on the job. Remember the last time a corporation tried to extend the colony? A runner edited the blueprints, and the airlock system failed. Some asteroid miners spotted the bodies floating by 'bout a month ago."

cards.title: Tycho Mem Chip
cards.text: Provides +3 MU.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +3 MU.
cards.flavor:
"You know there was actually a time when three megabytes was considered a score to the black market."
"What's a megabyte?"

cards.title: Umbrella Policy
cards.text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or hardware card from being trashed.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Prevent an installed program or hardware card from being trashed.
cards.flavor: "I cashed in their warranty when my utility was trashed by their own ice!" —Spider Murphy

cards.title: Urban Renewal
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 5 meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 5 meat damage.
cards.flavor: "The paper work has been clearly posted in the basement closet of City Hall since last Thursday."

cards.title: Vacant Soulkiller
cards.text:
You may advance Vacant Soulkiller before and after you rez it.
When Runner accesses Vacant Soulkiller, it does 1 brain damage for each advancement counter on it.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Vacant Soulkiller before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Vacant Soulkiller, it does 1 brain damage for each advancement counter on it.
cards.flavor: The original Soulkiller started as a matrix to contain artificial personalities, but Arasaka forced the original engineer to enhance the design for its own purposes.

cards.title: Vacuum Link
cards.text: [subroutine] Roll a die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3, Runner resumes the run from that many pieces of rezzed ice back, or jacks out. If there are not that many pieces of ice, Runner returns to the first piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Roll a die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3, Runner resumes the run from that many pieces of rezzed ice back, or jacks out. If there are not that many pieces of ice, Runner returns to the first piece of ice.

cards.title: Valu-Pak Software Bundle
cards.text: Gain up to five consecutive actions, which you may use only to install programs, and gain 1[bit]. If you do not spend the bit during these actions, return it to the bank afterwards.
cards.stripped_text: Gain up to five consecutive actions, which you may use only to install programs, and gain 1 bit. If you do not spend the bit during these actions, return it to the bank afterwards.

cards.title: Vapor Ops
cards.text:
You may advance Vapor Ops before and after you rez it.
Vapor Ops advancement Counter: Gain 1[bit].
[action]: Move any number of advancement counters from Vapor Ops to another installed card that can be advanced.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Vapor Ops before and after you rez it. Vapor Ops advancement Counter: Gain 1 bit. action: Move any number of advancement counters from Vapor Ops to another installed card that can be advanced.

cards.title: Vewy Vewy Quiet
cards.text: Put 2[bit] from the bank on Vewy Vewy Quiet when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits from the bank on Vewy Vewy Quiet when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.flavor: "You know what I like? Sneaking all the way in, and then barking all the way out!" —Dog

cards.title: Viral 15
cards.text:
[subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay 1[bit] to jack out, in addition to any other costs.
[subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner trashes an installed program after passing each piece of rezzed ice, including Viral 15, unless Runner jacks out.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay 1 bit to jack out, in addition to any other costs. [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner trashes an installed program after passing each piece of rezzed ice, including Viral 15, unless Runner jacks out.

cards.title: Virizz
cards.text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay an additional 1[bit] to break each ice subroutine.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay an additional 1 bit to break each ice subroutine.

cards.title: Virus Test Site
cards.text:
You may advance Virus Test Site before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Test Site, it does 2 Net damage per advancement counter on it, or 1 Net damage if it has no counters, even if it is not installed or rezzed.
Ignore this effect if Runner accesses it from the Archives.
If Test Site is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Virus Test Site before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Test Site, it does 2 Net damage per advancement counter on it, or 1 Net damage if it has no counters, even if it is not installed or rezzed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses it from the Archives. If Test Site is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

cards.title: Wall of Ice
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage.
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage. [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Wall of Static
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.

cards.title: Washington, D.C., City Grid
cards.text:
The difficulty of agendas installed inside this fort is reduced by 1.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: The difficulty of agendas installed inside this fort is reduced by 1. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Weather-to-Finance Pipe
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, the Corp loses 4[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, the Corp loses 4 bits.
cards.flavor: Fractal weather system modeling is best routed to Accounts Receivable if you want to cause a stir; a route to Market Research is likely to go unnoticed.

cards.title: Wild Card
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
3[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break sentry subroutine. 3 bits: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: The survival of Al Capone's cronies into cyberspace has almost spiritual significance to many runners.

cards.title: Wilson, Weeflerunner Apprentice
cards.text:
Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action, which you may use only to make a run. You cannot spend more than 3[bit] during that run to pay for using icebreakers or increasing your link. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn.
[trash]: Avoid receiving a tag.
[trash]: Prevent any amount of meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action, which you may use only to make a run. You cannot spend more than 3 bits during that run to pay for using icebreakers or increasing your link. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn. trash: Avoid receiving a tag. trash: Prevent any amount of meat damage.

cards.title: Wizard's Book
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break code gate subroutine.
2[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break code gate subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: Voluntas vincit omnia.

cards.title: Worm
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
3[bit]: +1 strength.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break wall subroutine. 3 bits: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "It's hard to describe—but don't eat anything just before you watch it go into action."

cards.title: WuTech Mem Chip
cards.text: Provides +1 MU.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU.
cards.flavor: "Here at WuTech, we take pride in our quest to make memory cheaper than water." —Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

cards.title: Zetatech Mem Chip
cards.text: Provides +2 MU.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +2 MU.
cards.flavor: In 2019, sales dipped because of a rumor that the odd chip contained a miniature transmitter that sent the chip's data, encrypted, to the nearest Zetatech facility.

cards.title: Zetatech Software Installer
cards.text: Put 2[bit] on Software Installer when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for installing programs. You may use these bits to install a program overwriting Software Installer itself. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits on Software Installer when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for installing programs. You may use these bits to install a program overwriting Software Installer itself. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: Zombie
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: Every time a runner encounters a Zombie again, she's gotta be sayin' to herself, "You used to be smarter than this!"

cards.title: ZZ22 Speed Chip
cards.text:
Put 2[bit] from the bank on ZZ22 Speed Chip when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using killers during runs.
If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits from the bank on ZZ22 Speed Chip when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using killers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

cards.title: π in the 'Face
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk..."

cards.title: Badtimes
cards.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Runner's MU is reduced by 2 until end of turn.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Runner's MU is reduced by 2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "They always think it's a hoax."

cards.title: Baskerville
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage.
[subroutine] Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a Baskerville counter. Each counter does 2 Net damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Baskerville counter by taking an action to spend 3[bit].
[subroutine] End the run.
If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Baskerville is reduced by 5[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage. [subroutine] Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a Baskerville counter. Each counter does 2 Net damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Baskerville counter by taking an action to spend 3 bits. [subroutine] End the run. If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Baskerville is reduced by 5 bits.

cards.title: Bolter Swarm
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 4 Net damage.
[subroutine] Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice encountered during this run.
If Runner has used a noisy icebreaker during this run, the cost to rez Bolter Swarm is reduced by 5[bit].

cards.stripped_text: After the turn in which you install Viacox, you gain an action during each of your turns, which you must take if possible. Roll a die at the start of each of your turns to find out what the action is. On a 1, draw a card. On a 2, gain 1 bit. On a 3, make a run on R&D. On a 4, make a run on HQ. On a 5, make a run on a subsidiary data fort. On a 6, reveal a card to the Corp at random from your hand, and play or install that card.

cards.title: Bel-Digmo Antibody
cards.text:
Shuffle Bel-Digmo Antibody into R&D when it is rezzed.
When Runner accesses Bel-Digmo Antibody from R&D, do 1 Net damage, and Runner must show it to you.
cards.stripped_text: Shuffle Bel-Digmo Antibody into R&D when it is rezzed. When Runner accesses Bel-Digmo Antibody from R&D, do 1 Net damage, and Runner must show it to you.

cards.title: Big Frackin' Gun
cards.text:
6[bit]: Break up to five sentry subroutines on a single piece of ice.
1[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 6 bits: Break up to five sentry subroutines on a single piece of ice. 1 bit: +1 strength
cards.flavor:
"Does that have to be your solution to everything?"
"Well... yes, now stand back."

cards.title: Black Widow
cards.text:
1[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
2[bit]: +1 strength.
Choose an installed piece of ice when you install Black Widow. Black Widow gets +5 strength during each encounter with that piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break sentry subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength. Choose an installed piece of ice when you install Black Widow. Black Widow gets +5 strength during each encounter with that piece of ice.
cards.flavor: "When she pours on the charm, a piece of ice falls hard."

cards.title: Blackmail
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, score 1 agenda point.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, score 1 agenda point.
cards.flavor: "...only if you fork over the negatives too, chombatta."

cards.title: Bolt-Hole
cards.text: [trash]: Prevent 2 meat damage. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Prevent 2 meat damage. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor:
"Over there!" BRRRRRRT! "Take out that wall!" Tink, tink, WHUMPF! "Okay, looks clear."
("Whew!")
"Did you hear something?"

cards.title: Boring Bit
cards.text:
2[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break wall subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength
cards.flavor: "An effective drill, but pretty dull."

cards.title: Brain Wash
cards.text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
cards.flavor: "I can see clearly now my brain is gone."

cards.title: Bug Zapper
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Bug Zapper.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Bug Zapper. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Try it for a month, and if it doesn't flatline anyone, send it back at our expense!"

cards.title: Bulldozer
cards.text:
1[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
2[bit]: +1 strength.
If Bulldozer breaks all the subroutines of a wall, and the next piece of ice encountered during this run is a sentry, break one of the subroutines of that sentry, at no cost.
Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Bulldozer, lose a total of 2[bit] from stealth cards.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break wall subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength. If Bulldozer breaks all the subroutines of a wall, and the next piece of ice encountered during this run is a sentry, break one of the subroutines of that sentry, at no cost. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Bulldozer, lose a total of 2 bits from stealth cards.

cards.title: Caryatid
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
When you rez Caryatid, you may pay 1[bit], above the rez cost, to make it a code gate instead of a wall.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. When you rez Caryatid, you may pay 1 bit, above the rez cost, to make it a code gate instead of a wall.
cards.flavor: "All the form and twice the function of our previous model—the Galatea."

cards.title: Charity Takeover
cards.text: Gain 9[bit] and 1 Bad Publicity point. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 9 bits and 1 Bad Publicity point. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.flavor: "We don't call them 'Black Ops' because they're immoral; we call them that because they put us in the black."

cards.title: Chiba Bank Account
cards.text:
1[bit], [trash]: Gain 4[bit]. You may use this ability whenever you pay any cost or penalty.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit, trash: Gain 4 bits. You may use this ability whenever you pay any cost or penalty. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "We keep your money safe ~~by~~ from prying eyes." —Chiba Mutual prospectus, edited draft for English-speaking investors

cards.title: Chihuahua
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trace 1-If trace is successful, do 1 Net damage.
Gain 2[bit] when you rez Chihuahua.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trace 1-If trace is successful, do 1 Net damage. Gain 2 bits when you rez Chihuahua.
cards.flavor: "Almost too cute to kick. Almost."

cards.title: Colonel Failure
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: War is the continuation of business by other means.

cards.title: Corporate Guard®️ Temps
cards.text: Pay two times X when you play Corporate Guard®️ Temps, to gain an action during each of your next X turns. Forfeit the next X you gain.
cards.stripped_text: Pay two times X when you play Corporate Guard Temps, to gain an action during each of your next X turns. Forfeit the next X you gain.
cards.flavor: "Now do you see why they never bill in advance?"

cards.title: Corporate Headhunters
cards.text:
Whenever Corporate Headhunters successfully does damage, Runner 's hand size is reduced by 1.
[action]: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever Corporate Headhunters successfully does damage, Runner 's hand size is reduced by 1. action: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
cards.flavor: "He wasn't much of a security risk, but we flatlined him anyway."

cards.title: Corrosion
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
1[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break wall subroutine. 1 bit: +1 strength
cards.flavor: Sometimes all it takes is a little drip to make a big hole.

cards.title: Cortical Cybermodem
cards.text:
Provides +2 MU and +2 hand size. Put 2[bit] from the bank on Cortical Cybermodem when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them from the bank at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +2 MU and +2 hand size. Put 2 bits from the bank on Cortical Cybermodem when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them from the bank at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Cortical Stimulators
cards.text: Prevents 1 Net or brain damage each turn.
cards.stripped_text: Prevents 1 Net or brain damage each turn.
cards.flavor: "Damn but those Zombies make your head itch!"

cards.title: Coyote
cards.text:
[subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all further ice is encountered at +1 strength, unless Runner pays 2[bit] while passing Coyote.
Gain 3[bit] when you rez Coyote.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of the run, all further ice is encountered at +1 strength, unless Runner pays 2 bits while passing Coyote. Gain 3 bits when you rez Coyote.

cards.title: Credit Blocks
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run. When you rez Credit Blocks, you may pay 1[bit], above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. When you rez Credit Blocks, you may pay 1 bit, above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
cards.flavor: "At the right frequency, the bull-and-bear pulse of a seasoned corp's financial curve will paralyze a sane mind."

cards.title: Credit Consolidation
cards.text: Gain 15[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Gain 15 bits.
cards.flavor: "Here's the balance sheet on our hidden accounts. I suggest we have Finance consolidate the newly decriminalized activities with the legitimate loan."

cards.title: Credit Subversion
cards.text:
[trash]: The Corp loses 3[bit]. Use this ability immediately after a successful run on HQ.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: trash: The Corp loses 3 bits. Use this ability immediately after a successful run on HQ. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor:
"What happened to that guy who used to clean the fish tanks?"
"He had a family emergency in Crystal Palace right after that screw-up in Finance."

cards.title: Cruising for Netwatch
cards.text: Gain 1[bit] and draw two cards.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 1 bit and draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "Back home on the bayou, before it dried up, the good ole boys would ambush federal patrolmen just to try out their new cyberware. Now we bushwhack stray Netwatch goons just to try out our new programs. Some things just don't go out of style." —Digital Dana

cards.title: Crumble
cards.text:
After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Crumble counter. Two or more Crumble counters allow you trash, at no cost, any cards accessed from HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Crumble counter. Two or more Crumble counters allow you trash, at no cost, any cards accessed from HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

cards.title: Cybertech Think Tank
cards.text: You may advance Cybertech Think Tank before and after you rez it. Cybertech Think Tank advancement counter: Increase by 1 the meat damage dealt by another source.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance Cybertech Think Tank before and after you rez it. Cybertech Think Tank advancement counter: Increase by 1 the meat damage dealt by another source.

cards.title: Data Sifters
cards.text: Play only if Runner trashed any nodes during his or her last turn. Give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner trashed any nodes during his or her last turn. Give Runner a tag.
cards.flavor: "The runner tried to crash the entire file structure, but the black-box routines on the login records held."

cards.title: Datacomb
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Datacomb, pay 1[bit], or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Datacomb, pay 1 bit, or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
cards.flavor: "Getting at the honey sometimes means taking a sting or two."

cards.title: Death from Above
cards.text:
[trash]: Trash, at no cost, all cards installed in a subsidiary data fort, even if they cannot normally be trashed. Use this ability only when you have just successfully made a run on that fort, and before accessing cards from that fort.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Trash, at no cost, all cards installed in a subsidiary data fort, even if they cannot normally be trashed. Use this ability only when you have just successfully made a run on that fort, and before accessing cards from that fort. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "They drop rocks; I commandeer battlesats."

cards.title: Death Yo-Yo
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
If Runner passes Death Yo-Yo, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Death Yo-Yo, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain 1 bit.
cards.flavor: "This is a trick I call 'walkin' the dog.'"

cards.title: Decoy Signal
cards.text: Make a run. Whenever you approach an unrezzed piece of ice during that run, expose it. You may jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. Whenever you approach an unrezzed piece of ice during that run, expose it. You may jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.
cards.flavor: "Neat piece of code. Reminds me of a weef I used to know." —Max Forward

cards.title: Demolition Run
cards.text: Make a run. If run is successful, do not access cards; instead, trash all rezzed ice on the fort on which you just made a run, and the Corp gives you three tags.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. If run is successful, do not access cards; instead, trash all rezzed ice on the fort on which you just made a run, and the Corp gives you three tags.
cards.flavor: "Sure it was worth it. Now hurry up and get packed; they'll be here any minute."

cards.title: Department of Misinformation
cards.text:
You may rez Department of Misinformation when Runner attempts to expose a card.
1[bit]: Prevent a card from being exposed.
cards.stripped_text: You may rez Department of Misinformation when Runner attempts to expose a card. 1 bit: Prevent a card from being exposed.
cards.flavor: "I'm sorry, sir, the department you requested does not exist. Could I get your name and number and have them call you back?"

cards.title: Digiconda
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 Net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
Pay X, above the rez cost, when you rez Digiconda. X is Digiconda 's strength, and X cannot be greater than 6.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 2 Net damage. [subroutine] End the run. Pay X, above the rez cost, when you rez Digiconda. X is Digiconda 's strength, and X cannot be greater than 6.
cards.flavor: "See that lump? It's still digesting the data from the last weeflerunner icon it caught."

cards.title: Disgruntled Ice Technician
cards.text: Make a run. After passing a piece of ice during this run, you may derez that ice and end your run if you broke all the subroutines of that ice.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. After passing a piece of ice during this run, you may derez that ice and end your run if you broke all the subroutines of that ice.
cards.flavor: "Even if they catch me doing this, they'll have me improving their ice to the bitter end. Of course, I'd rather that end not be strapped to a couch in Skälderviken."

cards.title: Disintegrator
cards.text: 2[bit]: Derez a piece of ice and end your run. Use this ability only when you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice and have successfully passed it.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Derez a piece of ice and end your run. Use this ability only when you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice and have successfully passed it.
cards.flavor: "Every time Dahlia laid out a sentry, I'd hand her Disintegrator and say, 'You do the honors.' But that got old in a hurry."

cards.title: Dog Pile
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 Net damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Dog Pile.
[subroutine] End the run.
Dog Pile has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside it.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 Net damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Dog Pile. [subroutine] End the run. Dog Pile has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside it.

cards.title: Doppelganger Antibody
cards.text:
When Runner accesses Doppelganger Antibody, you may pay 2[bit] to give Runner a Doppelganger counter, even if Doppelganger is not installed.
Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Doppelganger from the Archives.
Each Doppelganger counter causes Runner to lose 1[bit] at the start of each of his or her turns.
Runner may take an action to pay 4[bit] to remove a Doppelganger counter.
If Doppelganger is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Doppelganger Antibody, you may pay 2 bits to give Runner a Doppelganger counter, even if Doppelganger is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Doppelganger from the Archives. Each Doppelganger counter causes Runner to lose 1 bit at the start of each of his or her turns. Runner may take an action to pay 4 bits to remove a Doppelganger counter. If Doppelganger is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

cards.title: Drone for a Day
cards.text: Gain 9[bit] and the Corp gives you a tag.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 9 bits and the Corp gives you a tag.
cards.flavor: "Sure you won't stay? No one else here understands our business half as well as you do."

cards.title: Emergency Rig
cards.text: Rez a piece of ice, at no cost. Put X Kludge counters on that piece of ice; X cannot be 0. At the start of each of your turns, remove a Kludge counter. Trash that piece of ice when the last Kludge counter is removed from it.
cards.stripped_text: Rez a piece of ice, at no cost. Put X Kludge counters on that piece of ice; X cannot be 0. At the start of each of your turns, remove a Kludge counter. Trash that piece of ice when the last Kludge counter is removed from it.

cards.title: Enterprise, Inc., Shields
cards.text:
1[bit]: Prevent up to 2 Net damage.
1[bit]: Prevent 1 brain damage.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Prevent up to 2 Net damage. 1 bit: Prevent 1 brain damage.
cards.flavor: "I know I always feel more enterprising when my shields are up." —Advert

cards.title: Eurocorpse™️ Spin Chip
cards.text: Put 2[bit] from the bank on Spin Chip when it is installed. Spin Chip can have an icebreaker installed in it whose MU cost is no greater than 1. Use the bits on Spin Chip only to pay for using this icebreaker during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them from the bank at the start of your next turn.
cards.stripped_text: Put 2 bits from the bank on Spin Chip when it is installed. Spin Chip can have an icebreaker installed in it whose MU cost is no greater than 1. cards.title: Executive Boot Camp
cards.text:
Discard a card at random: Gain 2[bit]. Use this ability only during a run.
At the end of the run, return to the bank any of the 2[bit] you did not spend.
cards.stripped_text: Discard a card at random: Gain 2 bits. Use this ability only during a run. At the end of the run, return to the bank any of the 2 bits you did not spend.

cards.title: Expendable Family Member
cards.text:
1[bit], [trash]: Avoid receiving a tag.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit, trash: Avoid receiving a tag. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "I'm an only child... now."

cards.title: Faked Hit
cards.text:
Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point. Take 2 brain damage. This damage cannot be prevented.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point. Take 2 brain damage. This damage cannot be prevented. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.flavor: "I won't need much air with the coma drug, but I could still get hypoxia if you don't get me out of the bag in time."

cards.title: Fetal AI
cards.text:
When Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 Net damage, even if it is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Fetal AI from the Archives. If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
Runner must pay 2 to steal Fetal AI, in addition to any other costs.
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 Net damage, even if it is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Fetal AI from the Archives. If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you. Runner must pay 2 to steal Fetal AI, in addition to any other costs.

cards.title: Forward's Legacy

0[bit]: Break sentry subroutine.
At the start of each run, roll a die and add the result to Legacy's strength for that run.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break sentry subroutine. At the start of each run, roll a die and add the result to Legacy's strength for that run.

Play only if you made a successful run on both HQ and R&D this turn.
Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point. Give the Corp 1 additional Bad Publicity point if you liberated or trashed any Black Ops cards during those runs.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

cards.title: Fubar

1[bit]: Break a subroutine of the type chosen for Fubar.

[subroutine] End the run.

cards.text: Gatekeeper has one "[subroutine] End the run" subroutine for every 2[bit] you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
cards.stripped_text: Gatekeeper has one [subroutine] End the run subroutine for every 2 bits you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
