cards.title: HQ Mole
cards.text:
4[bit], [trash]: Access two additional cards from HQ. Use this ability only when accessing cards from HQ.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: 4 bits, trash: Access two additional cards from HQ. Use this ability only when accessing cards from HQ. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "I've got low friends in high places."

cards.title: Hunting Pack
cards.text: For each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Hunting Pack, Hunting Pack has one subroutine as follows: "[subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag."
cards.stripped_text: For each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Hunting Pack, Hunting Pack has one subroutine as follows: [subroutine] Trace 5-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

cards.title: Ice and Data Special Report
cards.text: Expose up to five cards installed in or on a single data fort.
cards.stripped_text: Expose up to five cards installed in or on a single data fort.
cards.flavor: "Max Forward is a freelance writer and netrunner, and has recently made available to the runner community the icebreaker technology he describes." —contributor's bio

cards.title: Iceberg
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 Net damage.
2[bit]: Iceberg has one "[subroutine] End the run" subroutine for the present encounter. Use this ability only when Runner encounters Iceberg.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 Net damage. 2 bits: Iceberg has one [subroutine] End the run subroutine for the present encounter. Use this ability only when Runner encounters Iceberg.
cards.flavor: The hidden mass of the Iceberg is a corp's bottom line.

cards.title: Identity Donor
cards.text:
Do not play Identity Donor as an action; instead, play it during the Corp's turn when you would suffer meat damage. Prevent that meat damage and give the Corp 2 Bad Publicity points.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Do not play Identity Donor as an action; instead, play it during the Corp's turn when you would suffer meat damage. Prevent that meat damage and give the Corp 2 Bad Publicity points. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

cards.title: LDL Traffic Analyzers
cards.text:
You may advance LDL Traffic Analyzers before and after you rez it.
You may rez LDL Traffic Analyzers during a trace attempt.
LDL Traffic Analyzers advancement counter: Gain 5[bit]. Use this ability only during a trace attempt.
When the trace attempt ends, return to the bank any of the 5[bit] you did not spend.
cards.stripped_text: You may advance LDL Traffic Analyzers before and after you rez it. You may rez LDL Traffic Analyzers during a trace attempt. LDL Traffic Analyzers advancement counter: Gain 5 bits. Use this ability only during a trace attempt. When the trace attempt ends, return to the bank any of the 5 bits you did not spend.

cards.title: Lesley Major
cards.text:
Install Lesley Major only in a subsidiary data fort.
5[bit]: Add two advancement counters, at no cost, to a card installed in this data fort. Use this ability only when Runner passes the last piece of ice on this fort, and only once per run.
cards.stripped_text: Install Lesley Major only in a subsidiary data fort. 5 bits: Add two advancement counters, at no cost, to a card installed in this data fort. Use this ability only when Runner passes the last piece of ice on this fort, and only once per run.

cards.title: Lesser Arcana
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
When you rez Lesser Arcana, you may pay 1, above the rez cost, to make it a wall  instead of a sentry.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. When you rez Lesser Arcana, you may pay 1, above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
cards.flavor:
"You'd think a hammer would blow through a wall of cards without even slowing down."
"You're taking the Net too literally again, kid."

cards.title: Liberated Savings Account
cards.text:
7[bit], [trash]: Gain 11[bit]. You may use this ability whenever you pay any cost or penalty.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: 7 bits, trash: Gain 11 bits. You may use this ability whenever you pay any cost or penalty. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "Honey, are you forgetting to record your credit transfers again?"

cards.title: Lisa Blight
cards.text: 1[bit], Discard a card at random: Repeat one subroutine on a piece of ice on this fort, until the end of the run. Treat the copy of the subroutine as if it appeared immediately after the original subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit, Discard a card at random: Repeat one subroutine on a piece of ice on this fort, until the end of the run. Treat the copy of the subroutine as if it appeared immediately after the original subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.
cards.flavor: "What do you mean she dumped secret plans for world domination? Somebody's got to unplug that witch!"

cards.title: Live News Feed
cards.text:
Make a run. If run is successful, the Corp gives you two tags, and you give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point for each black ice you encountered during the run, 1 for each Black Ops card the Corp rezzed during the run, and 1 for each Black Ops agenda you liberated during the run.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. If run is successful, the Corp gives you two tags, and you give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point for each black ice you encountered during the run, 1 for each Black Ops card the Corp rezzed during the run, and 1 for each Black Ops agenda you liberated during the run. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

cards.title: Lockjaw
cards.text: [trash]: Give one of your icebreakers +2 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during an encounter with a piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Give one of your icebreakers +2 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during an encounter with a piece of ice.
cards.flavor: "Yeah, but it's a little bit too loyal; it just doesn't know when to get out of the way."

cards.title: Lucidrine™️ Drip Feed
cards.text: At the start of each of your turns, if there are two Drip counters on Drip Feed, remove all Drip counters from it and take 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented; otherwise, put a Drip  counter on Drip Feed and gain an action.
cards.stripped_text: At the start of each of your turns, if there are two Drip counters on Drip Feed, remove all Drip counters from it and take 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented; otherwise, put a Drip counter on Drip Feed and gain an action.
cards.flavor: "By the time he jacked out, his girlfriend had left him, and the dog was dead."

cards.title: Manhunt
cards.text:
Play only if Runner attempted a run during his or her last turn.
Trace 6-If trace is successful, give Runner one tag for each point by which your trace exceeded his or her link.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner attempted a run during his or her last turn. Trace 6-If trace is successful, give Runner one tag for each point by which your trace exceeded his or her link.
cards.flavor: "I want his friends dead! I want his family dead! I want his deck dead!"

cards.title: Marcel DeSoleil
cards.text: 2[bit], Trash the top two cards stored in R&D: Repeat one subroutine on a piece of ice on this fort, until the end of the run. Treat the copy of the subroutine as if it appeared immediately after the original subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits, Trash the top two cards stored in R&D: Repeat one subroutine on a piece of ice on this fort, until the end of the run. Treat the copy of the subroutine as if it appeared immediately after the original subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.

cards.title: Marionette
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program.
[subroutine] End the run.
If Runner passes Marionette, pay 1[bit], or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program. [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Marionette, pay 1 bit, or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
cards.flavor: "The Marionette's not such a big deal; it's who's pulling the strings."

cards.title: Marked Accounts
cards.text: When Runner accesses Marked Accounts, give Runner a tag, even if it is not installed. If Marked Accounts is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Marked Accounts, give Runner a tag, even if it is not installed. If Marked Accounts is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
cards.flavor:
"First Eurobank called, reporting a failed credit transfer from one of our marked funds. They're giving us the perp's address."
"Good. So which fund was broken into?"
"Heh. Get this: 'Counterintrusion Disbursements.'"

cards.title: Mastermind
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Mastermind.
[subroutine] End the run.
Mastermind has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside it.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Mastermind. [subroutine] End the run. Mastermind has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside it.

cards.title: Mercenary Subcontract
cards.text:
4[bit], [trash]: Trash, at no cost, one or more cards that you are currently accessing, even if those cards cannot normally be trashed.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: 4 bits, trash: Trash, at no cost, one or more cards that you are currently accessing, even if those cards cannot normally be trashed. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "Now, remember to place the charges exactly where I tell you this time."

cards.title: Minotaur
cards.text: For each rezzed code gate or wall installed outside Minotaur, Minotaur has one "[subroutine] End the run" subroutine.
cards.stripped_text: For each rezzed code gate or wall installed outside Minotaur, Minotaur has one [subroutine] End the run subroutine.

cards.title: Misleading Access Menus
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless Runner pays 1[bit].
Gain 3[bit] when you rez Misleading Access Menus.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run unless Runner pays 1 bit. Gain 3 bits when you rez Misleading Access Menus.
cards.flavor: "You wouldn't believe how many suckers try to access 'Tools/Certain Death.'"

cards.title: Mobile Barricade
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 Net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
1[bit]: Move Mobile Barricade and insert it in a different position on this data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort. You may use this ability even if Mobile Barricade is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Do 1 Net damage. [subroutine] End the run. 1 bit: Move Mobile Barricade and insert it in a different position on this data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort. You may use this ability even if Mobile Barricade is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.

cards.title: Morphing Tool
cards.text:
2[bit]: Break a subroutine of the type last chosen for Morphing Tool.
1[bit]: +1 strength.
1[bit], [action]: Choose whether Morphing Tool breaks code gates, sentries, or walls. When you install Morphing Tool, choose whether it breaks code gates, sentries, or walls.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Break a subroutine of the type last chosen for Morphing Tool. 1 bit: +1 strength. 1 bit, action: Choose whether Morphing Tool breaks code gates, sentries, or walls. When you install Morphing Tool, choose whether it breaks code gates, sentries, or walls.

cards.title: Networked Center
cards.text:
The difficulty of Gray Ops agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort.
Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: The difficulty of Gray Ops agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.flavor: The LANs and WANs of the late 20th century gave way to SWANs (Super-Wide-Area Networks), which were as graceful at data relay as their acronym suggested.

cards.title: Obfuscated Fortress
cards.text:
At the start of a run on this fort, Runner must announce the number of bits he or she will spend during the run. Runner cannot spend more than this during that run. If Runner does not spend that many bits during that run, the Runner loses the remainder once the run is complete.
You may rez Obfuscated Fortress at the start of a run on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: At the start of a run on this fort, Runner must announce the number of bits he or she will spend during the run. Runner cannot spend more than this during that run. If Runner does not spend that many bits during that run, the Runner loses the remainder once the run is complete. You may rez Obfuscated Fortress at the start of a run on this fort.

cards.title: On the Fast Track
cards.text: Gain 8[bit] if you trashed an advertisement card this turn, or gain 6[bit] if you trashed a transactions card this turn.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 8 bits if you trashed an advertisement card this turn, or gain 6 bits if you trashed a transactions card this turn.
cards.flavor: "He was a nobody until I doctored their auditions database. I rigged that campaign to fail, of course, but it lasted long enough for him to get paid."

cards.title: Panic Button
cards.text:
Install Panic Button only in HQ.
1[bit]: Draw a card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
cards.stripped_text: Install Panic Button only in HQ. 1 bit: Draw a card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
cards.flavor: "As a last resort, I'm trying something I learned from Marketing: bombard him with sexy options and chances are he'll choose something he doesn't need."

cards.title: Pattel Antibody
cards.text:
When Runner accesses Pattel Antibody, you may pay 3[bit] to put a Pattel counter on all installed icebreakers, even if Pattel Antibody is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Pattel Antibody from the Archives. Each Pattel counter on an icebreaker reduces its strength by 1.
If Pattel Antibody is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Pattel Antibody, you may pay 3 bits to put a Pattel counter on all installed icebreakers, even if Pattel Antibody is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Pattel Antibody from the Archives. Each Pattel counter on an icebreaker reduces its strength by 1. If Pattel Antibody is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

cards.title: Pavit Bharat
cards.text:
Install Pavit only in a subsidiary data fort.
When you rez Pavit, uninstall all cards installed in this fort and store them in HQ. Install an equal number of cards from HQ in this fort.
Rez Pavit only when Runner has passed the last piece of ice on this fort.
cards.stripped_text: Install Pavit only in a subsidiary data fort. When you rez Pavit, uninstall all cards installed in this fort and store them in HQ. Install an equal number of cards from HQ in this fort. Rez Pavit only when Runner has passed the last piece of ice on this fort.
cards.flavor: "Pavit" means "pious"—but hey, it's not like any parents predict their kid will grow up to be a ruthless security agent.

cards.title: Pirate Broadcast
cards.text: Make a run on each data fort. Score 1 agenda point if all the runs are successful. Forgo your next action if any of the runs are not successful.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on each data fort. Score 1 agenda point if all the runs are successful. Forgo your next action if any of the runs are not successful.
cards.flavor: "It's scary how ineffective the law is these days. It used to be that we could turn corporate dirt over to the Feds, and let them do the rest of the network. Nowadays we have to do everything ourselves." —Digital Dana

cards.title: Please Don't Choke Anyone
cards.text:
For each 1 damage you successfully do, you may choose instead to prevent that damage and put a PDCA counter on Please Don't Choke Anyone.
PDCA counter: Gain an action. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn.
cards.stripped_text: For each 1 damage you successfully do, you may choose instead to prevent that damage and put a PDCA counter on Please Don't Choke Anyone. PDCA counter: Gain an action. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "First, let's consider the problem not as a series of independent actions, Bob, but as a series of... Oh lord, just kill him."

cards.title: Poisoned Water Supply
cards.text:
Play only if you have at least two connections in play. Trash two connections. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you have at least two connections in play. Trash two connections. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.flavor:
"'Canadian Mountain Spring Water'? That song's for the tourists. You just bought tap water, man!"
"PFFFFFT!"

cards.title: Prearranged Drop
cards.text: The next time you access an agenda this turn, gain 6[bit].
cards.stripped_text: The next time you access an agenda this turn, gain 6 bits.
cards.flavor:
"Maybe you and I could—"
"Keep it simple, stupid."

cards.title: Precision Bribery
cards.text: The Corp cannot create any new data forts. The Corp may trash Precision Bribery by taking an action to pay 4[bit]. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.
cards.stripped_text: The Corp cannot create any new data forts. The Corp may trash Precision Bribery by taking an action to pay 4 bits. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

cards.title: Project Venice
cards.text: For every three advancement counters over Project Venice 's difficulty that are on Project Venice when you score it, gain an action during each of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: For every three advancement counters over Project Venice 's difficulty that are on Project Venice when you score it, gain an action during each of your turns.
cards.flavor: "Attention all substations: Project Venice has crashed again due to server difficulties. Please observe safety precautions while unplugging any programmers or corprunners."

cards.title: Project Zurich
cards.text: For every two advancement counters over Project Zurich 's difficulty that are on Project Zurich when you score it, gain 1 at the start of each of your turns.
cards.stripped_text: For every two advancement counters over Project Zurich 's difficulty that are on Project Zurich when you score it, gain 1 at the start of each of your turns.
cards.flavor: "With only minor deviation from standard accounting practices, we can improve our bottom line significantly."

cards.title: Promises, Promises
cards.text: The next time you access an agenda this turn, score 1 additional agenda point.
cards.stripped_text: The next time you access an agenda this turn, score 1 additional agenda point.
cards.flavor: "Ishiguro apologizes for doubting your ability to find data incriminating our competitor. He humbly offers this unworthy gift for uncovering highly sensitive plans for world domination."

cards.title: R&D Mole
cards.text:
4[bit], [trash]: Access two additional cards from R&D. Use this ability only when accessing cards from R&D.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: 4 bits, trash: Access two additional cards from R&D. Use this ability only when accessing cards from R&D. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "Don't worry—you'll have the time. The new game on the system will keep them distracted for hours."

cards.title: Rasmin Bridger
cards.text: After Runner passes each piece of ice on this fort, Runner must pay 1[bit] or end the run.
cards.stripped_text: After Runner passes each piece of ice on this fort, Runner must pay 1 bit or end the run.
cards.flavor: "Fifty for the Shotgun Wire, twenty to get past the Filter—even the Hellhound wanted a cool three hundred! That place is worse than a third-world bureaucracy! We should seriously rethink their merger proposal." —Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

cards.title: Raymond Ellison
cards.text:
Install Raymond Ellison only in a subsidiary data fort.
[trash]: Remove any number of advancement counters from cards installed in this data fort. Gain 3[bit] for each advancement counter removed. Use this ability only during a run.
At the end of the run, return to the bank any of the bits gained that you did not spend.
cards.stripped_text: Install Raymond Ellison only in a subsidiary data fort. trash: Remove any number of advancement counters from cards installed in this data fort. Gain 3 bits for each advancement counter removed. Use this ability only during a run. At the end of the run, return to the bank any of the bits gained that you did not spend.

cards.title: Reconnaissance
cards.text: Make a run. Whenever the Corp rezzes a card during that run, gain 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. Whenever the Corp rezzes a card during that run, gain 1 bit.
cards.flavor: "We'll put a tap on your line and transfer credit after each piece of ice you hit. Oh, and don't worry, even if surge ice fries you, our buffers will ensure the data reaches us safely."

cards.title: Redecorator
cards.text:
1[bit]: Break up to two sentry subroutines on a single piece of ice.
3[bit]: +1 strength
cards.stripped_text: 1 bit: Break up to two sentry subroutines on a single piece of ice. 3 bits: +1 strength
cards.flavor: "I've wanted to name a Killer this ever since my SATs went out claiming to schools that I planned to become an interior decorator."

cards.title: Remote Detonator
cards.text: Play only if you made a successful run on a data fort this turn. Trash all rezzed ice on that fort, and the Corp gives you three tags.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on a data fort this turn. Trash all rezzed ice on that fort, and the Corp gives you three tags.
cards.flavor: It takes a long time—hundred of milliseconds!—to feed all the ice specs to the planted viruses, so you'd better be riding a Nasuko cycle through the fourth dimension, because the Corp has your number!

cards.title: Rent-to-Own Contract
cards.text: Rez a piece of ice, at no cost. Put on that ice a number of Term counters equal to its rez cost. At the start of each of your turns, if you have at least 2[bit], lose 2[bit] and remove one of these Term counters; otherwise, put a Term counter on that piece of ice.
cards.stripped_text: Rez a piece of ice, at no cost. Put on that ice a number of Term counters equal to its rez cost. At the start of each of your turns, if you have at least 2 bits, lose 2 bits and remove one of these Term counters; otherwise, put a Term counter on that piece of ice.

cards.title: Research Bunker
cards.text:
The difficulty of research agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: The difficulty of research agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.flavor:
"I want this Proteus ice tested by dawn."
"But, Dr. Kordite, it's already dawn."
"Do you think anyone in R&D knows that?"

cards.title: Riddler
cards.text: 2[bit]: Riddler has one "[subroutine] End the run" subroutine for the present encounter. Use this ability only when Runner encounters Riddler.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Riddler has one [subroutine] End the run subroutine for the present encounter. Use this ability only when Runner encounters Riddler.
cards.flavor: "Why is a raven like a write-protect?"

cards.title: Roadblock
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
When Runner encounters Roadblock, roll a die. On a 6, derez Roadblock, and Runner automatically passes it; otherwise, add the result to Roadblock's strength for that encounter.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. When Runner encounters Roadblock, roll a die. On a 6, derez Roadblock, and Runner automatically passes it; otherwise, add the result to Roadblock's strength for that encounter.
cards.flavor: "Do you have any stolen data to declare?"

cards.title: Runner Sensei
cards.text:
2[bit]: Base link 4.
2[bit]: +1 link. Gain 1[bit] whenever you successfully use Runner Sensei to avoid a trace.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.stripped_text: 2 bits: Base link 4. 2 bits: +1 link. Gain 1 bit whenever you successfully use Runner Sensei to avoid a trace. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
cards.flavor: "Do you have any stolen data to declare?"

cards.title: Rush Hour
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access three additional cards from R&D. You cannot use noisy icebreakers during the run.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access three additional cards from R&D. You cannot use noisy icebreakers during the run.
cards.flavor: "Sure there are more signals to hide in, but there's also a greater chance of someone being around who'll jump you if you get noticed."

cards.title: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm has one "[subroutine] End the run" subroutine for every 2[bit] you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
cards.stripped_text: Sandstorm has one [subroutine] End the run subroutine for every 2 bits you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
cards.flavor: "Like a snow crash, only much grittier."

cards.title: Scaffolding
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
If Runner passes Scaffolding, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Scaffolding, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain 1 bit.
cards.flavor: "Usually it's not the scaffolding that's the problem but whatever it is they're repairing on the other side."

cards.title: Scaldan
cards.text:
After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Scaldan counter. Each Scaldan counter forces the Corp to roll a die at the start of each of its turns. On a 5 or a 6, the Corp gains 1 Bad Publicity point.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Scaldan counter. Each Scaldan counter forces the Corp to roll a die at the start of each of its turns. On a 5 or a 6, the Corp gains 1 Bad Publicity point. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

cards.title: Schlaghund Pointers
cards.text:
Play only if Runner has attempted a run this game.
Trace 3-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Pay 1[bit], in addition to the normal cost, for each point of trace above 0.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner has attempted a run this game. Trace 3-If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Pay 1 bit, in addition to the normal cost, for each point of trace above 0.
cards.flavor: "The mark lives in a city that lets wild dogs run around as a way of curbing the homeless presence, and these puppies will blend right in."

cards.title: Senatorial Field Trip
cards.text:
Play only if the Corp rezzed a piece of Black Ice this turn. The Corp either derezzes that piece of ice or receives 2 Bad Publicity points.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if the Corp rezzed a piece of Black Ice this turn. The Corp either derezzes that piece of ice or receives 2 Bad Publicity points. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

cards.title: Simon Francisco
cards.text:
Install Simon Francisco only in R&D or HQ.
During a run in which Simon is accessed, Runner  accesses one less card stored in this fort.
cards.stripped_text: Install Simon Francisco only in R&D or HQ. During a run in which Simon is accessed, Runner accesses one less card stored in this fort.
cards.flavor: "No, no, we don't have enforcers here at Futokora. You must've met one of our customer service reps."

cards.title: Simulacrum
cards.text:
[trash]: Pass a piece of AP ice. You may use this ability during an encounter with a piece of ice.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Pass a piece of AP ice. You may use this ability during an encounter with a piece of ice. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.

cards.title: Siren
cards.text:
Rez Siren when you install it. Install Siren only if you can pay to rez it.
1[bit]: Runner must make a run on the fort Siren is installed in, if possible, instead of on the fort he or she was originally going to make a run on. Use this ability only at the start of a run.
cards.stripped_text: Rez Siren when you install it. Install Siren only if you can pay to rez it. 1 bit: Runner must make a run on the fort Siren is installed in, if possible, instead of on the fort he or she was originally going to make a run on. Use this ability only at the start of a run.
cards.flavor: "They'll come. Just leak one word: 'oops.'" —Magnificent Curtis

cards.title: Skeleton Passkeys
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break code gate subroutine.
3[bit]: +4 strength
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break code gate subroutine. 3 bits: +4 strength
cards.flavor: "Sometimes I'd rather have bare bones working for me than an army of muscle." —Max Forward

cards.title: Skullcap
cards.text: [trash]: Prevent any amount of Net or brain damage.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Prevent any amount of Net or brain damage.
cards.flavor: "Just the superficial sort of icon that someone grounded too far in 'reality' would think up. TURN UP THE FEED, YOU WIGGLY MEAT THINGS! THIS IS THE NET! NOTHING'S REAL! YOU HAVE NO HEAD!" —Rache Bartmoss

cards.title: Snowbank
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless Runner pays 1[bit].
Gain 3[bit] when you rez Snowbank.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run unless Runner pays 1 bit. Gain 3 bits when you rez Snowbank.
cards.flavor: "Sure you can jump right through, but let me tell you a story about a kid on my street who jumped off his fire escape into a snowbank...."

cards.title: Sphinx 2006
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
When you rez Sphinx 2006, you may pay 4[bit], above the rez cost, to make it a sentry instead of a code gate.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. When you rez Sphinx 2006, you may pay 4 bits, above the rez cost, to make it a sentry instead of a code gate.
cards.flavor: "What runs on four megs in the morning, two megs in the afternoon, and three megs in the evening?"

cards.title: Stakeout
cards.text: Gain 2[bit] and draw one card.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 2 bits and draw one card.
cards.flavor: "This is reconnaissance, not voyeurism, Wilson."

cards.title: Stereogram Antibody
cards.text: When Runner accesses Stereogram Antibody from the Archives, do 1 Net damage and shuffle Stereogram Antibody into R&D.
cards.stripped_text: When Runner accesses Stereogram Antibody from the Archives, do 1 Net damage and shuffle Stereogram Antibody into R&D.
cards.flavor: "Don't focus on it! Just let your deck's interface routines save you the headache... and the nosebleed from the feedback."

cards.title: Streetware Distributor
cards.text:
Take 1[bit] from Streetware Distributor, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns.
[action]: Put 3[bit] from the bank on Streetware Distributor.
cards.stripped_text: Take 1 bit from Streetware Distributor, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns. action: Put 3 bits from the bank on Streetware Distributor.
cards.flavor: "Way it works is, you choose an object off the shelf, and I give you the download key when you pay. Or you shoplift it, and it downloads automatically ...with the complimentary virus option."

cards.title: Subliminal Corruption
cards.text:
Make a run. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point for each advertisement you trash during the run.
If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point for each advertisement you trash during the run. If the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
cards.flavor: "'SFX'! It says, 'SFX'!"

cards.title: Sumo 2008
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
When you rez Sumo 2008, you may pay 1[bit], above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. When you rez Sumo 2008, you may pay 1 bit, above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
cards.flavor:
"I see the kanji characters on his belt translate to 'wide load.'"
"Plus, if you look real close, you can see I coded a smiley face in his navel."

cards.title: Sunburst Cranial Interface
cards.text:
Provides +1 MU and +1 hand size.
Put 1[bit] from the bank on Cranial Interface when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it from the bank at the start of your next turn.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: Provides +1 MU and +1 hand size. Put 1 bit from the bank on Cranial Interface when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it from the bank at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

cards.title: Swiss Bank Account
cards.text:
You may use the following abilities whenever you pay any cost or penalty.
[trash]: Gain 2[bit]. 3[bit],  [trash]: Gain 6[bit].
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: You may use the following abilities whenever you pay any cost or penalty. trash: Gain 2 bits. 3 bits, trash: Gain 6 bits. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.

cards.title: Syd Meyer Superstores
cards.text: [action]: Trash a rezzed piece of ice. Gain 4[bit].
cards.stripped_text: action: Trash a rezzed piece of ice. Gain 4 bits.
cards.flavor: "Let me get this straight: you ran the databanks of Syd Meyer Superstores with a 'breaker you bought at Syd's? Congrats, you just participated in their standard product-test program."

cards.title: Taxman
cards.text:
After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Tax counter. Every two Tax counters cause the Corp to lose 1[bit] at the start of each of its turns.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Tax counter. Every two Tax counters cause the Corp to lose 1 bit at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
cards.flavor: "The virus just alters their data. The actual damage is done by government auditors," —Spider Murphy

cards.title: Test Spin
cards.text: Search your stack for a program, and install it, at no cost. Shuffle your stack. If you install a program in this way, make a run. After the run, shuffle the program into your stack, unless it is no longer in play, in which case, lose 4[bit] plus its installation cost. If this is more than the number of bits in your pool, suffer the difference in meat damage.
cards.stripped_text: Search your stack for a program, and install it, at no cost. Shuffle your stack. If you install a program in this way, make a run. After the run, shuffle the program into your stack, unless it is no longer in play, in which case, lose 4 bits plus its installation cost. If this is more than the number of bits in your pool, suffer the difference in meat damage.
cards.flavor: "And when you bring it back, we'll deactivate the code bomb for free."

cards.title: The Deck
cards.text:
0[bit]: Base link 5.
1[bit]: +1 link.
Provides +1 MU.
Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Base link 5. 1 bit: +1 link. Provides +1 MU. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
cards.flavor: "...oh, and I'll also need a '20 Moebius Link." "A what?" "You know, Forward's deck. The Deck." "Gotcha."

cards.title: The Personal Touch
cards.text: Put a +1 strength counter on an icebreaker.
cards.stripped_text: Put a +1 strength counter on an icebreaker.
cards.flavor: "I think that if I'd been spending my time and money on any other 'breaker than Dahlias, my girlfriend would have understood."

cards.title: Time to Collect
cards.text:
[trash]: Prevent one or more of your other installed resources from being trashed. Use this ability only during the Corp 's turn.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: trash: Prevent one or more of your other installed resources from being trashed. Use this ability only during the Corp 's turn. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.

cards.title: Toughonium™️ Wall
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: It's so tough you can't even think about breaking it.

cards.title: Tumblers
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
If Runner passes Tumblers, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain 1[bit].
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Tumblers, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain 1 bit.
cards.flavor: "They're not pistons. They just put the flattened icon in as a sick joke."

cards.title: Twisty Passages
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
If Runner passes Twisty Passages, pay 1[bit], or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. If Runner passes Twisty Passages, pay 1 bit, or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
cards.flavor: It's got routines that specifically target Smarteye; the eyeball becomes a little eight ball that says, "You see a little file here. Do you want to go (n)orth or (s)outh?"

cards.title: Underworld Mole
cards.text:
Play only if Runner installed any resources during his or her last turn.
Trace 4-If trace is successful, trash a resource Runner installed during his or her last turn and give Runner a tag.
cards.stripped_text: Play only if Runner installed any resources during his or her last turn. Trace 4-If trace is successful, trash a resource Runner installed during his or her last turn and give Runner a tag.
cards.flavor: Everybody knows somebody who knows a little too much about anybody.

cards.title: Vienna 22
cards.text:
After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Vienna counter. Each Vienna counter allows you to access an additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Vienna counter. Each Vienna counter allows you to access an additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

cards.title: Viral Breeding Ground
cards.text: When you score Breeding Ground, trash all cards installed in or on the fort Breeding Ground was installed in. When Runner accesses Breeding Ground, choose up to two programs for each advancement counter on Breeding Ground; Runner brings those programs into his or her hand.
cards.stripped_text: When you score Breeding Ground, trash all cards installed in or on the fort Breeding Ground was installed in. When Runner accesses Breeding Ground, choose up to two programs for each advancement counter on Breeding Ground; Runner brings those programs into his or her hand.

cards.title: Viral Pipeline
cards.text:
After each successful run on Archives, HQ, or R&D, put a Socket counter in that data fort.
Socket counter from Archives, Socket counter from HQ, and Socket counter from R&D: Give the Corp a Pipe counter. Each Pipe counter causes the Corp to forgo an action at the start of each of its turns.
The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
cards.stripped_text: After each successful run on Archives, HQ, or R&D, put a Socket counter in that data fort. Socket counter from Archives, Socket counter from HQ, and Socket counter from R&D: Give the Corp a Pipe counter. Each Pipe counter causes the Corp to forgo an action at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

cards.title: Walking Wall
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
1[bit]: Move Walking Wall and insert it in a different position on this data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort. You may use this ability even if Walking Wall is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] End the run. 1 bit: Move Walking Wall and insert it in a different position on this data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort. You may use this ability even if Walking Wall is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.

cards.title: Washed-Up Solo Construct
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash a program unless Runner pays 1[bit].
Gain 3[bit] when you rez Washed-Up Solo Construct.
cards.stripped_text: [subroutine] Trash a program unless Runner pays 1 bit. Gain 3 bits when you rez Washed-Up Solo Construct.
cards.flavor: "Before they made my construct, they told me, 'You're getting too slow for street work, but we can transfer you into software security.' How was I to know?"

cards.title: Weapons Depot
cards.text:
The difficulty of Black Ops agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1.
Rez a region when you install it.
Install a region only if you can pay to rez it.
Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.
cards.stripped_text: The difficulty of Black Ops agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

cards.title: Weefle Initiation
cards.text: Make a run. Prevent up to 7 damage during that run.
cards.stripped_text: Make a run. Prevent up to 7 damage during that run.
cards.flavor:
"Lost another one."
"So?"

cards.title: Wired Switchboard
cards.text:
[trash]: +3 link. Use this ability only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent on the trace attempt.
Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.stripped_text: trash: +3 link. Use this ability only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent on the trace attempt. Hidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.
cards.flavor: "I use a lot more explosive than I need, so they think it's a random structure hit. There's no way to track all those down, so they usually don't bother."

cards.title: World Domination
cards.text: Score an additional 4 agenda points when you score World Domination.
cards.stripped_text: Score an additional 4 agenda points when you score World Domination.
cards.flavor:
"So, Wilson, how in the frack did you know the fileset was secret plans for world domination?"
"'Cause it was laveled 'Secret Plans for World Domination.'"

cards.title: Wrecking Ball
cards.text:
0[bit]: Break wall subroutine.
2[bit]: +1 strength.
Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Wrecking Ball, lose 1[bit] from a stealth card.
cards.stripped_text: 0 bits: Break wall subroutine. 2 bits: +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Wrecking Ball, lose 1 bit from a stealth card.
cards.flavor: "'Form of a Dwarf!' 'Shape of a Pile Driver!' I'm sick of this Proteus crap. Gimme a good, old-fashioned hammer program any day."
